这个摊位是一个装饰着各种奇异画作与布料的细高盒子。在一个巨大的窗口下方，色彩艳丽的背景幕布前，伸出了半打套着各式木偶的手。

你们看着台上的表演，很快便意识到，这故事里的英雄正是你们自己。一个个打扮得酷似你们的木偶，正在屠杀代表堕落者的木偶，无数红色的彩带像喷血一样到处飞溅。

这个花哨的木偶剧场由一名 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.FqcgFfeQkIDWCLak]{愚人使者}* 负责运营。任何坐下来观看木偶戏的人都会发现，戏里演的正是角色们击败某个堕落者的场景。虽然表演夸张，但细节却出奇地精确，仿佛编排这出戏的人当时就在现场旁观一样。

这位骇人的木偶大师鼓励观众参与互动以换取奖励！在下方的堕落者的命运表中掷骰，以决定上演哪一出戏。角色可以选择作为观众参与木偶戏，并进行相关的属性检定。该检定的DC为20，但如果角色分享了表中指定的个人私事，DC可降至15。若成功，角色将赢得三张奖券。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.QKwLde3bTEPxVolH]{堕落者的命运}

C3: Prize Counter.name: C3. 奖品兑换台 (Prize Counter)
C3: Prize Counter.text:
C3 奖品兑换台

一座绘有宝藏、咧嘴笑的太阳以及皇冠的高大货摊矗立在此，货架上陈列着供狂欢者用奖券兑换的奖品。查尔克斯亲自看守着摊位，一边咯咯傻笑，一边分发着木雕乌鸦、毛绒玩具龙和弄臣套装。当你们走近时，他拍着手，发出仿佛逗弄婴儿般的声音说道：“气-气-气鼓鼓的冠军们来啦，是来救他们的朋友哒！”

庆典参与者们可以在这里用奖券兑换奖品兑换表上的玩具、饰品和代币。

奖品兑换

奖券奖品
1愤怒乌鸦毛绒玩偶
1涂成带血模样的木制玩具剑
1一双鳄鱼皮鞋
1从头到脚都穿着黑色蕾丝和布料的瓷娃娃
1一罐密封的胶水。胶水涂抹后需10分钟变干，之后若要将粘合的物品分开，需执行操作动作并成功进行DC10的力量检定。
1一套儿童尺寸的铲子和桶
2一张来自 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.Wk7EOYoY3b2tgGoS]{_幻象牌组_} 的单卡
2@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.L887NdWEP5NqHCrQ]{_治疗药水﹝强效﹞_}
2@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.DxIdfGoJEYQj8o3D]{_铁锈色魔术袋_}，但只能变出山羊
3@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.TiEpbl4UYlhy3t22]{_狂欢服_}*
3一瓶随机的_超自然药水_*
5一件随机的_诅咒奇珍_*
6一张 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.jhhT9PsHy5A7EojO]{_复生术法术卷轴_}
不定释放一名狂欢者﹝见下文“兑换率”﹞

每种魔法物品仅有一件库存。但这个摊位的真正目的是让角色们用奖券来换取他们那十二位来自柳沼村的朋友的性命——这些人已被洗脑并塞进了狂欢者戏服里﹝见本章前文“被迫狂欢者”﹞。

兑换率。查尔克斯释放第一名狂欢者只需仅仅1张奖券。但第二名需要2张，第三名需要3张，以此类推。这种不断攀升的代价是查尔克斯计划的一部分，旨在刺激角色们去憎恨并谋杀他。

服从小丑的命令。一旦所有十二名被困在戏服里的NPC都被救出，查尔克斯就会按计划开始游行﹝见本章后文“愚人游行”﹞。

反抗小丑。如果角色们在救出所有十二名村民之前攻击查尔克斯，查尔克斯会沾沾自喜地问道：“你们真的确定想让你们的朋友在游行里表演吗？你们一定非常恨我吧。那是真-真-真心的吗？”

如果有人明确表示他们憎恨查尔克斯，他会高兴地咯咯怪笑，并传送至他在游行中的预定位置，游行随即开始﹝见本章后文“愚人游行”﹞。

C4: The Roads Out.name: C4. 出村道路 (The Roads Out)
C4: The Roads Out.text:
C4 出村道路

柳沼村的道路已被这场嘉年华的噩梦魔法扭曲得蜿蜒畸变。角色第一次试图逃离村庄时，会莫名其妙地发现自己来到了静寂教堂﹝区域C5﹞。在随后的尝试中，除非成功进行一次 [[/check SUR DC 20]] 检定，否则他们会被误导回庆典广场﹝区域C2﹞。如果成功，他们将逃离柳沼村，任由其在查尔克斯的卑劣魔掌中受尽蹂躏，直到他们归来。

如果该检定失败达到三次，他们会被重定向回奖品兑换台﹝区域C3﹞，在那里，查尔克斯会问他们是不是玩腻了。“为了你们的朋友乐-乐-乐此不疲的狩猎，有没有让你们恨上我和我的游戏呀？我是不是该带大家直奔游-游-游行啦？”他问道。如果他们回答是，则见下文“愚人游行”。

C5: Silent Church.name: C5. 静寂教堂 (Silent Church)
C5: Silent Church.text:
C5 静寂教堂

在柳沼幽谷，只有一个地方能免受查尔克斯邪恶操纵的影响——那座废弃的教堂。当角色们进入时，朗读或转述以下内容：

当你们踏入这座废弃教堂时，庆典那遥远的喧嚣声瞬间消失了。狂欢派对的灯光无法穿透这里漆黑的窗户。

在那简朴的祭坛前，矗立着一尊近八尺的高耸大理石骑士雕像。他那石质的面庞扭曲成轻蔑的表情。突然，一个声音在你们的脑海中低语，在寂静中回荡：

“只要吾之石躯尚存，此处便容不得角王弄臣之力逞凶。闯入者，如实道来——尔等何人，因何而至？”

这便是大理石之人，一位雕刻于早已失落的光明时代的神话守护者。教堂看守人韦斯顿·默多克并不知道，大理石之人能引导神圣力量，并且已经觉醒以保卫柳沼村。它使用 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.z3gSIXHHWYaHjfBT]{石魔像} 数据卡，但它会说通用语，且智力值为14。

大理石之人解释说，村里的邪恶力量过于强大，他无法离开教堂，但他会保护任何被送到他这里的村民。将被迫狂欢者﹝见本章前文“被迫狂欢者”﹞带到教堂，只要他们待在里面，就能压制那股强迫他们狂欢的邪恶魔法。

休息。这座教堂是角色们休息的安全之地。他们甚至可以在这里进行长休。当他们出来时，外面仿佛时间并未流逝；所有人依旧像之前那样不知疲倦地狂欢。

Parade of Fools.name: 愚人游行 (Parade of Fools)
Parade of Fools.text:
愚人游行

当所有十二名被迫狂欢者﹝见本章前文“被迫狂欢者”﹞都被释放，或者当有人当面告诉查尔克斯他们憎恨他时，这一高潮事件便随即开始。本场战斗使用地图21.2。朗读或转述以下内容：

大地颤抖，一架看不见的管风琴奏响了魔鬼般的汽笛风琴曲，无数狂欢者随着这混乱的节奏猛力跺脚。狂欢者们放弃了嬉闹，汇聚成一股蜿蜒穿过街道的人潮。由一支高举雕像的仪仗队开路，这股由舞者、杂耍演员和体操演员组成的洪流向你们涌来。那些高杆上的雕像分别是：稻草人、骑士、海盗、女祭司、半羊人和掘墓人。

随着游行队伍席卷全镇，两名手持凶残长戟的狂欢者突然脱离队列，将手中的兵刃舞成了一团致命的钢铁旋风，翻着跟头向你们逼近！

掷先攻！这场对抗两名戴面具的 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.FqcgFfeQkIDWCLak]{愚人使者}* 的战斗可能会在庆典广场﹝C2﹞或奖品兑换台﹝C3﹞旁爆发。

当这两名狂欢者被击败后，他们那瓷质的丑角面具碎裂，露出了面具下的菲利普和阿黛拉。尽管身负致命伤，他们却依然站立着，兴高采烈地感谢角色们救了他们。成功进行一次 [[/check INS DC 8]] 检定便可以揭示这两人毫无疑问就是菲利普和阿黛拉，但他们那若无其事的举止却让人心里发毛；仿佛那些伤口和鲜血不过是舞台上的妆效，显然德鲁斯肯瓦尔德夫妇正陷入谵妄。

还没等角色们深入调查，查尔克斯便翻着跟头闯了进来。朗读或转述以下内容：

“哎哟喂！”查尔克斯咯咯直笑。“还没轮到这两位小可爱出场呢，可不能让你们先瞧见了。请往超级-无敌-大舞台右侧退场！陛下给你们安排了更重要的角色！”他轻轻一点，菲利普和阿黛拉便炸成漫天彩带，消失无踪。“跟上，跟上！”他指着五月柱说道。

查尔克斯跳着舞地前往庆典中心。一旦角色们回到庆典广场﹝区域 C2﹞，朗读或转述以下内容：

游行队伍在庆典场地的中心停了下来，无数狂欢者围成一圈，将广场封锁在不祥的氛围之中。摊位都不见了。只剩下那根五月柱，那张狞笑的小丑脸正盘踞其上。

查尔克斯坐在那个怪诞的气球顶上，但你们听到的不再是他那尖细的声音。取而代之的，是五月柱发出的深沉、咆哮般的男中音：“现在，我们的压轴大戏开始了。我们相信你们已经开始憎恨我们了，毕竟我们的恶作剧和闹剧可都是为你们量身定做的！对不对呀，各位？”人群欢呼雀跃。

“没错！为英雄们三欢呼！正是你们的屠杀为角之王的盛大登场做好了铺垫！剩下的就是杀了你们……或者杀了我。无论哪种，这登场仪式都够排场的。”

至少有三名狂欢者正围着五月柱跳舞。当战斗开始时，检查还有多少被俘的村民﹝见本章前文“被迫狂欢者”﹞未被解救。他们会出现在这里，面具已摘下，一边尖叫求救，一边受魔法驱使围着五月柱疯狂起舞。这些爪牙，无论是否为被迫的俘虏，均使用 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.FqcgFfeQkIDWCLak]{愚人使者}* 数据卡，但他们只有30生命值且没有多重攻击动作。

任何作为被迫狂欢者在此的镇民，只有在角色先伤害他们时，才会脱离五月柱并发起攻击。否则，他们会继续跳舞直到查尔克斯被击败。

庆典威能

随着战斗打响，嘉年华那狂欢的能量达到了顶峰，并仿佛拥有了生命。在先攻轮到20﹝先攻相同则视为后手﹞时，庆典狂欢会引发以下一种效应；它不能连续两轮使用同一种效应：

加入共舞。如果战斗中的愚人使者少于三名，一名愚人使者﹝使用上文提到的调整后的数值﹞会跳着舞冲出人群，加入战斗。它与其他使者使用同样的先攻，若没有其他使者，则在先攻轮到20时行动。

彩带捆绑。彩带、飘带或三角旗活化并缠住受害者。力量豁免：DC15，城镇广场内至多两名生物。失败：目标的速度变为0。目标在每个其回合结束时可重复豁免，豁免成功则终止自身该效应。如果庆典再次使用此选项，该效应提前结束。

小吃轰炸。嘉年华食物从人群中飞出，砸向广场内的一名生物。该生物在攻击检定以及维持专注的豁免检定中受到-2减值，持续至下一轮的先攻轮到20。

Phase 1: Fool for a Day.name: 阶段 1：一日为愚 (Phase 1: Fool for a Day)
Phase 1: Fool for a Day.text:
阶段 1：一日为愚

那个长着彩带触手的臃肿小丑气球才是 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.jZT2sUjFGSRkDa2K]{愚人之王}* 的真身；角色们目前为止互动过的那个弄臣木偶形态，只是他力量与人格的投射。战斗开始时，查尔克斯很乐意让角色们误以为那个弄臣影像就是他，并尽可能多地使用他的整蛊电击器动作进行战斗。任何通过攻击、触碰或对其施法来与该影像互动的角色，需进行一次 [[/save INT DC 15]] 检定。豁免失败时，他们会把这种不可能的互动合理化，认为攻击未命中、法术被抵抗，甚至认为攻击成功了。豁免成功时，角色会意识到这个弄臣只是一个无实体的幻象。

任何看穿影像本质的角色，或者执行研究动作以检查该区域并成功进行一次 [[/check INV DC 15]] 检定的角色，都能辨识出那个气球才是真正的反派。

当查尔克斯浴血时，战斗进入阶段2。

Phase 2: Carnival of Chaos.name: 阶段 2：混乱嘉年华 (Phase 2: Carnival of Chaos)
Phase 2: Carnival of Chaos.text:
阶段 2：混乱嘉年华

那个画着艳俗小丑脸的巨大气球膨胀并升入空中，将其底下的柱子从地面拔起。它怪诞地在庆典场地上漂浮、弹跳，嘴巴开合，发出查尔克斯的声音：“好啦，伙计们，咱们开干吧！是时候让你们都来当一日傻瓜啦！”

狂乱弹跳。查尔克斯变得愈发焦躁且充满攻击性。在其每个回合开始时，他可以跳跃至多等于其速度的距离至一处未占据空间，且不触发借机攻击。

无趣赴死

当查尔克斯的生命值降至0时，朗读或转述以下内容：

那弄臣的脑袋如同被斩首般猛地崩飞，发出一声狂野的哀嚎。随着幻象消散，一具无头木偶哗啦一声瘫散在地。与此同时，五月柱顶端的气球头急剧膨胀，仿佛充气过度一般变得硕大无比。最终，它挣脱柱子，呼啸着直冲云霄。它越飞越高，身形在视野中不断缩小，最后炸成了一朵巨大的烟花。伴随着深沉而不祥的笑声，无数发光尘埃在空中勾勒出一张狞笑的小丑脸，转瞬即逝。

等级提升。当角色们击败查尔克斯后，若他们仍为10级，则将提升至11级。

命运塔罗占卜。如果在第九章的命运塔罗占卜中抽到了魔术师，那么便可以在那具无生命木偶的木手中找到 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.0iohxmDyP2BZ7uc8]{_愚人之王的笏杖_}*。

Conclusion: Show's Over!.name: 结局 (Conclusion)
Conclusion: Show's Over!.text:
结局：演出落幕！

五彩纸屑如雨般洒落，柳沼村的街道恢复了原本的大小和布局。随着查尔克斯的附魔逐渐消退，没人注意到这些变化。镇民们脑海中只留下一段美好的记忆：庆典剧团把东西装上马车驶离小镇，而“大愚人”查尔克斯挥手告别，与他的整个剧团一路唱着快乐的歌谣离去。

那些狂欢者、装饰品以及庆典中的其它一切事物，都化作烟雾和闪光消散。查尔克斯永远地离开了，终于从他对角之王的义务中解脱了出来。

重返柳沼村

只有角色们和在庆典期间被解救的NPC还记得那场邪恶的狂欢。他们倒头便睡，享受这来之不易的休息（他们获得1级力竭）。醒来后，NPC们会与角色聚在一起，拼凑这几个夜晚发生的恐怖经历。

角色们不知道的是，菲利普和阿黛拉已被歪曲者抓获，并被带到了歪屋。凭借凯琳的远古力量和秽鸣集会的重生，那座屋子已经重新苏醒。

随着愚人之王被献祭，旧途信众们知道，阿黛拉的时刻已经到来。那些效忠于歪曲女王的人从镇上消失，前往柳沼村北部的高沼荒原，去建造用于最终献祭的柳条人。

Chapter 22: The Crooked Nightmare.name: 第22章 - 歪曲梦魇 The Crooked Nightmare
第22章 - 歪曲梦魇 The Crooked Nightmare
Chapter 22: The Crooked Nightmare.text:
第二十二章

歪 曲 梦 魇

「噢，菲利普，我做了一个极其可怕的梦！我看见我们要建立的那个光辉灿烂的美丽世界化为了灰烬与烟尘。我最近总是噩梦不断。全是因为这栋该死的房子。我敢肯定！」

——阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德

梦魇在歪屋中再次苏醒。虽然曾被逐个击杀，但秽鸣集会如今已借由歪曲女王凯琳的恶毒力量重生归来。尽管这三个邪恶的鬼婆彼此憎恨，她们却被强行融合，成为了一个恐怖的畸变憎恶。如今，她们正在扭曲具有预知能力的阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德那充满力量的梦境，以实现她预言中的宿命。这栋宅邸已无法被净化，唯有将其与集会一同彻底摧毁，才能终结这一切恐怖。

章节背景

随着堕落者的毁灭与愚人之王的献祭，预言仪式的下一环节便是献祭阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德，以此让角之王重获肉身，并将歪曲女王从囚笼中释放。然而，只有当她的肉体、心智与灵魂都准备就绪时，那场注定要在罗温高丘顶端的柳条人中进行的焚烧仪式才能开始。

这些准备工作正是秽鸣集会在被诛杀前所肩负的邪恶使命。然而，她们恶毒的灵魂并未消散，凯琳将其复活为可憎的形态，意图最后一次利用她们那扭曲的魔法。如今，她们已将阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的预知梦境拽入歪屋，并将之与凯琳那深埋地底的原始力量编织在一起，将整座宅邸化作一场粉碎了现实本身的、活生生的梦魇。

在注视着角色们于柳沼幽谷经历种种艰难试炼后，歪曲者正在他的旧宅中静候他们的到来，期冀着能为火刑堆增添更多的祭品。他深知自己将如他的角之王那般，被赐予一具全新的躯体。他化身为柳条人的时刻已至，而他所要做的，仅仅是再将那些所谓的英雄多拖延片刻。

章节概要

随着秽鸣集会以全新的融合形态重生，歪屋也随之苏醒。歪曲者已将德鲁斯肯瓦尔德一家——又一次——以及詹金一家困在了屋内。进入这场梦魇的角色需完成以下目标：

  • 接近德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园，并确保丹妮·詹金的安全。

  • 进入歪屋，与歪曲者对峙，并见证这栋房屋崩解为歪曲梦魇。

  • 闯荡恐怖的梦境世界，沿途解救沃尔特·詹金、吉莉·詹金以及菲利普·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德。

  • 在歪屋的阁楼直面秽鸣集会的鬼婆们，并摧毁集会憎恶。

在主持本章之前，请回顾一下主要的NPC，这些角色此前都曾与玩家角色有过交集：德鲁斯肯瓦尔德一家、詹金一家、秽鸣集会以及歪曲者。通读歪曲梦魇中的各个地点与梦境场景，以便更好地临场处理每一场遭遇。

本章节为四名11级角色设计。

Quest Hooks.name: 任务引子 (Quest Hooks)
Quest Hooks.text:
任 务 引 子

在角色们平息了愚人节的骚乱后，他们可能会选择前往德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园，查看菲利普和阿黛拉的状况。若非如此，请使用下方的任务引子。

浪子

当角色们身处柳沼村时，老锈会主动找上门来，试图在村镇边缘或奠基者广场拦下他们。朗读或转述以下内容：

广场管理员老锈伫立在你们面前，仿佛已在此恭候多时。他双目圆睁，满是惊恐，却又流露出一丝罕见的清醒。他开口说话了，嗓音听上去比往日更加沉稳、克制。

“我看见他了。那个砍杀我父母的人。他抓走了他们。山羊与羔羊。领主与夫人。山丘上的屋宅正在做梦。害兽再次以此四处窜动。它们正在酝酿一切的终结。”

老锈的神智并未完全清醒，但显然他所言非虚。如果角色们尚未发觉他就是弗朗西斯——约瑟夫与盖尔·帕特里尼之子，那么一次成功的 [[/check HIS DC 15]] 或 [[/check INV DC 15]] 检定，便能理清其中的联系。

如果有人在他身旁提起帕特里尼这个姓氏，老锈会用力地点头。随即，角色们会感到心中涌起一股暖意，耳畔传来遥远的大键琴声——因为他们完成了约瑟夫·帕特里尼的遗愿。他们将获得持续 [[/r 1d4]] 小时的法术 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{祝福术} 效应(见第十二章中的“H3：客厅”)。

Return of the Crooked House.name: 歪屋归来 (Return of the Crooked House)
Return of the Crooked House.text:
歪 屋 归 来

当角色们登上山丘，穿过德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园的大门时，朗读或转述以下内容：

德鲁斯肯瓦尔德庄园的状况已然大变。上次你们见到它时，那些超自然的异象与怪诞扭曲的房屋结构早已烟消云散。而今，它却再次变得歪曲畸形。

凄厉的尖叫声从建筑内部传出。妖艳的红光从窗棂间透出，随即又骤然熄灭，归于黑暗。墙壁上渗出一种黏滑的紫色物质。

丹妮·詹金正大步流星地冲向门廊。然而，还没等她踏上那如波浪般起伏的台阶，她的爱犬小壳便从一丛疯狂扭动的灌木中窜出，将她扑倒在地。

如果角色试图解读这只狗的行为或评估当前局势，那么成功进行一次 [[/check ANI DC 15]] 或 [[/check INS DC 15]] 检定后，他们便会意识到这只动物并非想要伤害丹妮。恰恰相反，它是在极力阻止她进入屋内。这只狗实际上是莎莉·洛克伍德的转世之灵，她深知屋内那些邪恶的精魂与生物绝非这个小女孩所能抵挡。

与丹妮交谈

小壳死死拖住丹妮，直至角色们赶到。随后，这只狗放开了丹妮，并用鼻子拱着她，将她推向角色们。

利用以下要点来引导角色与丹妮之间的对话。小壳也会尽其所能地通过动作向角色们传达信息。如果角色施展了能与动物交谈的法术，那么可以参考本章末尾莎莉灵魂解脱时的对话内容，来处理借由小壳之口与莎莉进行的交流(见本章后文的“结局：不再做梦”)。

  • 丹妮的父母听到了菲利普和阿黛拉的尖叫声，便冲进了庄园宅邸。就在他们进去之后，房子发生了异变。

  • 屋内传出许多声音，呼唤着丹妮进去与父母团聚。她问道：“你们听不到那些声音吗？”除非成功进行一次 [[/check PRC DC 17]] 检定，否则角色们无法听到这些声音。若检定成功，他们会听到那些令人毛骨悚然且完全陌生的声响。

  • 她能感应到那些鬼婆就在屋内，并深知必须将她们消灭，否则那些迷失在屋内的灵魂将再无生机。如果角色们不允许丹妮进入，她会恳求他们进去，查明她的父母以及德鲁斯肯瓦尔德一家的遭遇。

  • 丹妮能感应到阿黛拉的恐惧，以及她在屋内所经历的噩梦。她知道自己的父母和菲利普都已经迷失在了那场梦境之中。

  • 她告诉角色们，如果他们能救出里面的所有人，她就能指引大家逃离阿黛拉的噩梦。虽不知道具体原理，但她确信自己能做到这一点。

对话结束后，只要角色们答应进入屋内对付鬼婆，丹妮就会乖乖听从他们的任何安排。

Into the Nightmare.name: 踏入梦魇 (Into the Nightmare)
Into the Nightmare.text:
踏 入 梦 魇

角色们将丹妮与小壳留在身后，毅然踏入那恐怖的歪屋，誓要彻底终结其中的邪恶。

Crooked Nightmare Features.name: 歪曲梦魇特征 (Crooked Nightmare Features)
Crooked Nightmare Features.text:
歪曲梦魇特征

除非另有说明，否则歪曲梦魇内的各个区域均具备以下通用特征：

无尽梦境。 歪曲梦魇中的梦境场景均悖逆常理，无论其外观看似处于何地。若有生物试图离开当前区域，无论其移动了多远或朝哪个方向行进，最终都会发现自己又回到了原地。

歪曲之门。 歪曲之门遍布于梦魇各处，通常出现在那些常理上不可能存在门的地方。这些门扉会诱人地敞开，露出其后旋转翻涌的红光。角色踏入其中便会消失踪影，并在虚无中等候。一旦所有角色都穿过门扉，他们便会一同抵达下一处地点。

无路可逃。 歪曲梦魇是一个半位面。任何旨在脱离此地的法术均会失效，那些将生物放逐至其他存在位面的效应亦是如此。

害兽。 歪曲梦魇中滋生着秽鸣集会所钟爱的各类害兽。每当角色在感知(察觉)或智力(调查)检定中失败时，他们并不会一无所获，而是会发现一只黄鼬、蜈蚣或鸽子。

预言。 那些试图与其他存在位面的生物或实体取得联系的法术，将会转而收到来自阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德的、如呓语般的狂乱预言。

Crooked Nightmare Locations.name: 歪曲梦魇地点 (Crooked Nightmare Locations)
Crooked Nightmare Locations.text:
歪曲梦魇地点

以下地点是梦魇中各不相同的梦境场景，其顺序遵循地图22.1上的遭遇流程图。

N1: Crooked Pit.name: N1 歪曲深坑 (Crooked Pit)
N1: Crooked Pit.text:
N1 歪曲深坑

当角色们进入歪屋时，朗读或转述以下内容：

当你们步入门厅，身后的门扉随即关闭。令你们颇感意外的是，此处竟是一尘不染，舒适宜人。然而，随着一声沉闷的巨响，这虚假的美好瞬间崩塌——歪曲者脖套绞索，从头顶上方坠落而下。就在他重重砸向瓷砖地面的瞬间，整座歪屋分崩离析，化作了一片噩梦般的梦境景象。

房屋的碎片在你们周身盘旋，一阵刺耳的轰鸣声骤然响彻四周。墙壁、地板与天花板的残片，连同家具、装饰以及这栋破败庄园内曾经的一切，都在房屋外墙原本所包围的空间中疯狂乱舞。

一阵邪恶的尖笑合唱从上方回荡而来，透过漫天碎片，你们能看见阁楼的地板似乎远在数百尺之外。歪曲者也加入了这狂笑之中，紧接着脚下的地板崩塌陷落。你们开始向着无尽的黑暗坠落。

歪曲者 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.0KmT8pNN6lQ0fjH3]{Crooked Man}* 会在他与角色们一同坠入这看似无底的深坑、落向歪屋下方深处时发起攻击。他发出尖厉的狂笑，欣喜若狂地颂扬着歪曲女王的力量，这股力量正在他曾视为家园的宅邸之下滋长。这场战斗具有以下特征：

自由落体。 在坠落期间，无论如何移动，角色们与歪曲者相对于四周墙壁始终保持在同一水平面上。角色可以在此平面上移动，距离上限为自身的速度。任何尝试进行飞行、滑翔、漂浮、减缓坠落或传送的行为均会失效。

滑腻墙壁。 无底深坑的土质墙壁上渗出一种类似于腐坏血液的粘稠物质。任何尝试攀爬、抓握或附着于墙壁的行为均会失效，任何试图减缓坠落的行为亦是如此。

歪曲残骸。 来自歪屋的残骸碎片会在战斗中一同坠落。在先攻轮到20(先攻相同则视为后手)时，一块残骸碎片会飞向一名随机角色。该角色必须进行一次 [[/save DEX DC 18]] 豁免，豁免失败则会遭受在歪曲残骸表中掷出的对应效应。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.XoF9X5PC9txEECk8]{歪曲残骸}

当歪曲者的生命值降至0时，朗读或转述以下内容：

系在歪曲者脖子上的绳索终于绷直了。伴随着令人作呕的颈骨折断声，他的身体猛然一顿，而你们则越过他，继续向下坠落。随着他的身影越来越小，他发出一阵毛骨悚然的笑声。他在你们上方高声呼喊，声音在深坑中回荡。

“享受这场梦魇吧，朋友们！恕我不奉陪了，我得去阁楼接回我们的小梦想家，为终幕大戏的主角做好准备！”

就在角色们与残骸继续坠落之际，歪曲者消失了。他传送到了阿黛拉沉睡的阁楼。他意图将她带往柳条人处，那座位于柳沼村以北的高沼中、耸立在罗温高丘之顶的造物现已完工。与此同时，角色们毫发无伤地降落在了一片黑暗的林地中央(区域N2)。

N2: Dark Wood.name: N2 幽暗林地 (Dark Wood)
N2: Dark Wood.text:
N2 幽暗林地

你们降落在一片不祥森林的潮湿地面上，尽管经历了仿佛永恒般的坠落，你们却未感到丝毫疼痛。感受着秋夜的微风，四周环绕着山毛榉、白蜡树和山核桃树，你们抬头望去，只见一轮满月高悬，那张狞笑的女巫面孔已不见踪影。随即，你们听到了一个小女孩惊恐的啜泣声，那呼救声似乎从四面八方传来。“求求你们帮帮我！我迷路了！”

孩子的呼喊声在角色们周围回荡。作为一个搜索动作，若角色试图追踪声音来源并进行一次 [[/check PRC DC 15]] 或 [[/check SUR DC 15]] 检定，便能确定声音最响亮的方向。

手印。 循着声音前行，你们会发现一棵树，其树根至树干三尺高的地方布满了白色的、孩童大小的手印。每隔十五尺便有一棵同样的树，它们构成了一条通往森林深处的小径。沿着这条树木标记的小径前行10分钟，伴随着沿途孩子那充满哀求的哭喊声，你们来到了一片空地。

你们抵达了一片被满月照亮的林间空地，看见一个身穿白裙的小女孩。尽管从未见过她，但这女孩却给你们一种难以挥去的熟悉感。她的棕色卷发垂在肩头，睁着噙满泪水的灰蓝色大眼睛注视着你们，手里紧紧抱着一个怪异生物的毛绒玩具。“弗雷德里克说他要把你们一口吞掉……”

这个小女孩(绝对中立，人类非战斗平民 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmCommoner000000]{Commoner}) 对她的假想朋友弗雷德里克告诉她的事情感到恐惧。她解释说，她的玩偶弗雷德里克是一只独眼怪兽的玩具版，长得像是火鸡和恐龙的混合体。

如果角色们靠近，她会变得越发紧张，并告诉他们弗雷德里克非常饿，想要吞吃他们的血肉。她低声说，如果她松开手，弗雷德里克就会把她的血肉也吃掉。她很害怕，不知所措。本区域的战斗请使用地图22.2。

小阿黛拉。 女孩右脸颊上的痣看起来很眼熟。成功进行一次 [[/check INV DC 15]] 检定的角色可以推断出，这必定是童年时的阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德。

弗雷德里克。 当有角色移动到阿黛拉的毛绒玩具5尺范围内时，它会瞬间变形为一只 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.fuJHMByh1BJraTQi]{Gobblegeist}* 并攻击角色。当噬血怪鸟的生命值降至0时，它会变回毛绒玩具。

在弗雷德里克被打败后，小阿黛拉会为她的假想朋友道歉，并将其归咎于“坏虫夫人”。话音刚落，斯托诺佳·黑刺那刺耳的尖笑声便响彻了空地。小阿黛拉瞪大了眼睛，刹那间，一股无形的力量拽着尖叫不已的她拖入了森林深处。

歪曲之门。 当角色们沿着小阿黛拉被拖走的方向追踪时，他们会发现一扇奇怪歪斜的门伫立在林地上，门上布满了孩童大小的白色手印。任何试图离开这扇门周边区域的行为，都会触发歪曲梦魇的无尽梦境特征。大门敞开，仿佛在向角色们招手；它通向区域N3。

宝藏。 当小阿黛拉被卷走时，她掉落了她的毛绒玩具弗雷德里克。这个玩具可作为一个 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.R60glVqGFDyPQMIo]{Corn Dolly}* 魔宠使用。

N3: Crooked Oven.name: N3 斯托诺佳的烤炉 (Stonoga's Oven)
N3: Crooked Oven.text:
N3 歪曲烤炉

当你们踏入这个有着房间般大小的巨大烤炉时，一股令人窒息的灼热浪潮扑面而来。这地方让人不由得联想到歪屋厨房里那个烤炉的巨型版本。烈焰在空间深处咆哮，砖墙上固定的烤肉叉正串着一只巨大的爬行类火鸡怪兽进行炙烤。

吉莉·詹金被锁在室内的第二根铁制烤肉叉上，她满脸通红，在被慢慢活烤的痛苦中发出凄厉的尖叫。而在房间一侧，斯托诺佳·黑刺正转动着一个巨大的曲柄来旋转烤肉叉——她身上那件所谓的大厨装束，简直是一种恶俗至极的滑稽模仿。

斯托诺佳·黑刺 (@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.dNjGVwXYioTw7396]{Centipede Hag}*) 的幻象发出一阵欢快的尖笑，声称处理祭品的躯体可是一门艺术，而菲利普的那位宝贝妻子将会得到比这只刚宰杀的火鸡更彻底的烘烤。如果这个鬼婆幻象受到任何伤害，她便会消失。

解救吉莉。 吉莉·詹金被三根沉重的上锁铁链固定在烤肉叉上。即便角色们不攻击斯托诺佳，也请掷先攻！这三根铁链必须在10轮内全部移除，否则吉莉将死于致命的烧伤。

这些铁链的AC为17，HP为1，伤害阈值为40，并且免疫钝击、穿刺、毒素、心灵和挥砍伤害。当吉莉被铁链困住时，她无法成为法术或其他魔法效应的目标。

角色可以使用一个操作动作来进行以下任意一项DC20的属性检定，来解锁、破坏、挣脱或以其他方式摆脱铁链：

  • [[/check ATH DC 20]]{力量(运动)}，用于破坏铁链

  • [[/check SLT DC 20]]{敏捷(巧手)}，使用盗贼工具进行开锁

  • [[/check INV DC 20]]{智力(调查)}，用于找出铁链上易于撬开或破坏的薄弱环节

  • 其他由你判定为合适的检定

在每轮先攻轮到10和20(先攻相同则视为后手)时，烤炉内的烈火会喷发出一股火焰，随机以一名角色或吉莉为目标。该目标必须进行一次 [[/save DEX DC 17]] 豁免，豁免失败则受到 [[/damage 2d10 fire]]{11 (2d10)} 火焰伤害。如果目标是吉莉，她能存活的轮数将减少1轮。这些火焰喷发会持续发生，直至所有角色离开该区域或死亡。

当三根铁链全被移除后，吉莉便会从烤肉叉上跌落获救。如果她还活着，此刻的她正处于极度的恐惧与痛苦之中。她的反应就像是听到了一个角色们听不到的声音。她呼唤着女儿丹妮的名字，随后在一阵蓝色迷雾的旋涡中被丹妮拉出了梦境。

炙烤噬血怪鸟。 烤肉叉上炙烤的野兽正是小阿黛拉口中那个名为弗雷德里克的生物的怪物形态。对烤肉造成10挥砍伤害可以切下一块美味的肉。作为一个操作动作，角色可以吃下一块肉并恢复 [[/damage 2d8 healing]]{9 (2d8)生命值}。仅有最初切下的三块肉具有治疗功效。

歪曲之门。 在吉莉·詹金逃脱或死亡后，一扇歪曲之门会出现在烤炉的火焰中，通向区域N4。穿过这扇门的生物必须进行一次 [[/save CON DC 17]] 豁免，豁免失败则因高温而获得1 &reference[exhaustion apply=false] 级力竭。拥有火焰伤害抗性或免疫的生物自动成功于该豁免。

N4: Smoking Crater.name: N4 坠星 (Falling Star)
N4: Smoking Crater.text:
N4 冒烟陨坑

你们步入了一个凉爽的夏夜，头顶是一轮皎洁的半月，没有一丝歪曲怪诞的迹象。远处，隔着一个小海湾，你们看见一座繁华都会闪烁的灯火，其天际线高耸入云，直插夜空。就在前方，乡村大地上赫然出现了一个巨大的陨石坑，坑内仍冒着烟，似乎撞击才刚刚发生。在陨坑的边缘，一道奇异而多彩的光芒照亮了一个人类的轮廓。那人伫立凝视着坑内之物，随后纵身一跃，消失在视野之中。

当角色们靠近陨坑时，他们看见坑内有一块巨大的、冒着烟的陨石，正脉动着各种难以想象的色彩——甚至是那些根本不可能存在的颜色。一个十几岁的少女正缓缓走向那颗坠落的星辰，她头也不回地对着上方的角色们呼喊道：“难道你们听不到那些低语吗？！它们正在呼唤我们回家！”本区域的战斗使用地图22.3。

少女阿黛拉。 这声音显然属于阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德(绝对中立，人类非战斗平民 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmCommoner000000]{Commoner})，尽管她现在的模样比在森林里时年长了十岁。当她走到那脉动的陨石旁时，她满怀敬畏地凝视着它，并招手示意角色们加入她，以便大家能一同前往星辰之外旅行。成功进行一次 [[/check INS DC 15]] 检定的角色可以明确看出，她已被这颗坠星所迷惑。她目前正受天外低语影响而处于魅惑状态。

天外低语。 当有生物越过边缘踏入倾斜的陨坑时，他们会听到喋喋不休、难以理解的低语，且必须进行一次 [[/save INT DC 17]] 豁免。豁免失败者将陷入 &refrence[charmed apply=false] 状态，且以此方式被魅惑期间，该生物每轮必须尽可能多地消耗其移动力，向陨石方向移动。豁免成功者在24小时内免疫该效应。被魅惑的生物在受到伤害时，或在看不见陨石的情况下开始其回合时，可以重掷该豁免，豁免成功则终止该效应。

能说深潜语的角色可以解读出，这些低语正在邀请他们踏上一场穿越星辰、前往无法理解之领域的旅程，但这趟旅途需要抛弃肉体。唯有他们的心智能够成行。

天外入侵者。 当一名角色首次移动到陨石5尺范围内时，陨石崩裂，一只 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.grit0JinU8cmNnSN]{Invader Out of Space}* 从中升起，攻击角色们直至其被摧毁。任何毁灭之触Disrupting Touch攻击若命中被天外低语魅惑的生物，则视为重击。因这种伤害而死亡的生物，其身体将化为尘埃，仅留下大脑或负责思考的等效器官。

坠星。 在先攻轮到20(先攻相同则视为后手)时，崩裂的陨石会脉动着诡异的、源自天外的色彩。位于坠星60尺范围内且能看到这些色彩的生物，必须进行一次 [[/save INT DC 15]] 豁免，豁免失败则需在坠星表中进行掷骰，以确定遭受的异星体验及其效应。异怪自动成功于此豁免。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.iMoIIM834l8Y7PQf]{坠星}

当域外天魔被摧毁后，少女阿黛拉恢复了神智。她揉着眼睛，试图摆脱恍惚状态，说她是跟着一只怪异的鸽子才来到这里的。

话音刚落，葛洛柏·灰喉那尖锐的鸣叫声便响彻四周，阿黛拉尖叫着急速升空冲入夜幕，消失在一颗闪烁的星辰之中。

歪曲之门。 阿黛拉消失后，一扇歪曲之门从坠星的裂缝中升起。角色们必须爬上这颗7尺高的陨石才能触及这扇通往区域N5的门。穿过这扇门的生物必须进行一次 [[/save INT DC 17]] 豁免，豁免失败则受到 [[/damage 2d10 psychic]]{11 (2d10)} 心灵伤害。

宝藏。 当大门从陨石中浮现时，一块发光的石块剥落下来，落在角色脚边。这块碎片是一颗 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgReserveIounSt]{艾恩石(储法)}。

N5: Crooked Bookshelf.name: N5 葛洛柏的图书室 (Grob's Library)
N5: Crooked Bookshelf.text:
N5 歪曲书架

你们踏上了一个巨大的书架，随即便意识到自己似乎被缩到了微型的尺寸。你们认出书架开口外那个巨大的房间正是歪屋的图书室。突然，一张属于怪兽般巨猫的脸庞挡住了视线，它那硕大的爪子紧紧抓着你们站立的木板，正不怀好意地盯着你们。那只你们熟知的、名为“小缕”的生物已然变形，正露出一口剃刀般锋利的牙齿向你们狞笑。

和你们在同一个书架上的，是一个巨大的玻璃醒酒器。沃尔特·詹金被困在其中，惊恐万分。他站在齐腰深的烈酒中，一边用力敲打着玻璃，一边无声地尖叫。尖锐、刻薄的声音响彻四周，向沃尔特喷吐着恶毒的仇恨。葛洛柏·灰喉也加入了这合唱，她栖息在醒酒器的玻璃塞上，身穿一套极其荒谬拙劣的女教师装束。她发出一阵尖笑，用嘲弄的语调大声喊道：

“可怜的沃尔特曾是这样一个‘好人’。他是我所认识的人类中最忠诚的——认识他简直让我倒尽了胃口！但只需几个恰到好处的谎言，就能让他迷失自我，变成作茧自缚的囚徒！我倒要看看，你们有本事让他重拾忠诚吗？！”

葛洛柏·灰喉 (@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.KdPNwELUxUB6SwlF]{Pigeon Hag}*) 的幻象斜睨着角色们，得意洋洋地夸耀着自己是如何借由欺诈之语与致幻之物，才得以完成了这预备献祭心灵的完美工序。她幸灾乐祸地说，阿黛拉从未学会如何控制那颗她不配拥有的强大心灵，而这也最终导致了她的毁灭。如果这个鬼婆幻象受到任何伤害，她便会消失。即便角色们不攻击葛洛柏，也请掷先攻！

醒酒器。 玻璃醒酒器免疫所有伤害，且无法移动。其瓶塞无法从外部通过任何手段移除，但如果沃尔特选择逃离，他可以轻易地从内部将其顶开。然而，他所遭受的精神折磨让他对此解法浑然不觉，除了在极度绝望中无力地拍打玻璃外，做不了任何事。

小缕。 即便角色们此前在歪屋事件(见第十二章)中已杀死了那只恶毒的窃语猫妖，这个梦魇版本的小缕依然再次窃取了沃尔特的声音。如今变得体型巨大的小缕咧嘴狞笑，它不仅用沃尔特的声音说话，还模仿着吉莉、丹妮、索默顿镇长以及其他任何你认为合适的镇民的声音。它喷吐着恶毒的话语，将这个男人死死钉在自我厌恶的泥沼中动弹不得。

小缕仅露出头颅和爪子探入书架，一边用绝望包裹着沃尔特，一边向角色们发起攻击。它使用 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmSphinxOfLore00]{Sphinx of Lore} 数据卡，并做如下调整：阵营为混乱邪恶，体型为巨型，生物类型为妖精，且利爪造成心灵伤害。若小缕的生命值降至 0，其会伴随着一声惨叫而消失。

解救沃尔特。 囚禁沃尔特的巨大醒酒器内，酒液水位不断上涨。他惊恐万分，痛苦地抱着头。在第10轮的先攻轮到0(先攻相同则视为后手)时，沃尔特将溺毙于酒液之中。

唯有沃尔特自己才能拯救自己，但他无法独自办到。通过唤醒他人格中最核心的特质——忠诚感，可以让他从梦魇引发的无力感中猛醒过来。这可以通过鼓励来实现，也可以让他目睹自己关心的人陷入极度危险来达成。他的初始忠诚值Loyalty为0，当以下任意情况发生时获得提升：

振奋 (获得1忠诚)。 对小缕发动的攻击造成了重击。

决意 (获得1忠诚)。 对角色发动的攻击造成了重击，或一名角色在小缕迫使的豁免检定中失败。

胜利 (获得3忠诚)。 小缕的生命值降至0。

鼓舞 (获得1忠诚)。 作为一个影响动作，一名角色使用以下方法之一(或其他任何你认为合适的方法)成功进行一次DC20的属性检定：

  • [[/check DEC DC 20]]{魅力(欺瞒)}，用于分散小缕的注意力，阻止其施加更多的心智折磨。

  • [[/check PER DC 20]]{魅力(游说)} 或 [[/check INT DC 20]]{魅力(威吓)}，用于激励沃尔特屏蔽那些言语辱骂或让他振作起来。

  • [[/check HIS DC 20]]{智力(历史)} 或 [[/check NAT DC 20]]{ 智力(自然)}，利用逻辑帮助沃尔特意识到这场梦魇充满了谎言。

当他的忠诚值达到6时，沃尔特便会摆脱那因折磨而导致的无所作为。他顶开醒酒器的玻璃塞并爬了出来，虽然深受惊吓、伤痕累累，但毕竟活了下来。他的反应就像是听到了一个只有他能听见的声音，随后呼唤女儿丹妮，丹妮在一阵蓝色迷雾的爆发中将他拉出了梦魇。

歪曲之门。 在沃尔特·詹金逃脱或死亡后，一扇歪曲之门出现在小缕那张满是利齿的巨型笑脸影像中。要穿过此门，角色必须进行一次 [[/save DEX DC 17]] 豁免，豁免失败则受到 [[/damage 2d10 slashing]]{11 (2d10)} 挥砍伤害。此门通向区域N6。

N6: Wedding Feast.name: N6 婚宴 (Wedding Feast)
N6: Wedding Feast.text:
N6 婚宴

你们步入了无月之夜的黑暗中，天空中仅悬挂着一弯新月那微弱的轮廓。春日花卉的芬芳伴随着喜庆的音乐与欢快的人声在空气中飘荡。在你们面前的草地中央，正举办着一场婚宴，挤满了载歌载舞的宾客。他们身着各式各样的奇装异服，脸上都戴着动物面具。

越过摆满丰盛酒食的长桌与草地上的舞池，便是一座设有新郎新娘席位的高台。阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德身穿一套繁复累赘的礼服，头戴一顶由红、橙、黄三色玫瑰编织而成的色彩斑斓的花冠，透过花丛仅能看见她的脸庞。在她身旁，栓在高台上的是新郎——一只普通的黑色山羊，脖子上戴着带铃铛的皮项圈。

二十名婚礼宾客(人类 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmCommoner000000]{Commoners}) 立即邀请角色们加入他们的舞蹈，以庆祝这桩美好的联姻，见证新郎与新娘将彼此的灵魂许诺给对方。同意加入并随宾客共舞的角色可以自由行动。拒绝的角色必须进行一次 [[/save WIS DC 18]] 豁免，豁免失败则陷入 &reference[charmed apply=false] 状态，持续1分钟。以此方式被魅惑期间，该角色必须加入人群进行舞蹈。本区域的战斗使用地图22.4。

新娘阿黛拉。 如今已完全成年的阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德(绝对中立，人类非战斗贵族 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmNoble000000000]{Noble})，正如痴如狂地瞪大双眼，脸上挂着极不自然的微笑。她欢快地大笑着，对角色们高声喊道：“将灵魂交付给另一半，这是何等的快乐啊！”她邀请他们登上高台，献上祝福并亲吻她的手与山羊的蹄子，与她一同庆祝这场婚礼。

黑山羊。 阿黛拉那无尽的喜悦，与她身旁山羊 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGoat0000000000]{Goat} 所散发出的焦躁恐惧形成了鲜明对比。那山羊拼命挣扎着想要摆脱将其栓在高台上的绳索，在铃铛的叮当声中疯狂地试图逃离。每个角色都必须进行一次 [[/check ANI DC 15]] 检定。若角色处于魅惑状态，则该检定具有劣势。检定成功者会注意到，这只动物似乎是对婚礼宾客中移动的某个东西产生了反应，就好像有捕食者正在附近潜伏。检定失败者将在随后的攻击中遭到突袭。

最后一舞。 当角色们进入高台5尺范围内时，一只 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.YanMa8w09aAgP7oZ]{Drakkenhob}* 从人群中窜出，它先是一口吞掉了黑山羊，随即向角色们发起攻击。所有宾客纷纷退至一旁，围成一圈观看战斗。他们满怀喜悦地注视着这一切，为每一次猛击和死亡欢呼喝彩。

婚礼之歌。 在先攻轮到20(先攻相同则视为后手)时，婚礼宾客们将他们的音乐融入进这首直击灵魂的战斗之歌中。所有角色都必须进行一次 [[/save CHA DC 15]] 豁免，豁免失败则将遭受婚礼之歌表中某一随机乐器的效应影响。

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.4nCzFhOZnRXs7cm4]{婚礼之歌}

当盛装龙驹被摧毁后，阿黛拉笑容尽失，开始审视眼前这刺眼的一幕。她询问菲利普在哪里，随即意识到自己正身处歪屋之中。话音刚落，维斯拉·褐牙那轻蔑的嘶嘶声便在一场血腥屠杀中撕碎了婚礼宾客。而阿黛拉的身形也瞬间起火，她连同那身花朵礼服顷刻间化为灰烬，只留下一声痛苦的尖叫。

歪曲之门。 阿黛拉消失后，一扇歪曲之门从宴会桌上升起，通向区域N7，而此时的桌面上已布满了被屠杀宾客的血肉。穿越这片腐臭的修罗场，进入此门的角色必须进行一次 [[/save CON DC 17]] 豁免，豁免失败则陷入 &reference[poisoned apply=false] 状态，持续1小时。

N7: Crooked Throne.name: N7 歪曲王座 (Crooked Throne)
N7: Crooked Throne.text:
N7 歪曲王座

你们步入了一个陌生而古老的冰冷地下室，那里破败崩塌的石质地板与墙壁全都歪斜得惊人，并且覆盖着厚厚的冰层。无数哀嚎的灵魂如同一场狂暴的暴风雪，在这个空间内汹涌激荡。透过这场亡魂风暴，你们看见菲利普·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德正坐在一张由盘根错节的根须构成的王座上，那些根须缠绕遍布他的全身，将他死死束缚在座位上。一顶由荆棘编织而成的歪曲王冠戴在他的头顶，一道道鲜血顺着他的脸庞淌下。他的右手紧握着一支燃烧的火把，左手则拿着一个苹果。

夹杂在受罚者那冰冷的呻吟声中的，是维斯拉·褐牙恶毒的嘲笑。她身穿一套极其荒诞滑稽的天使装束，正用一把燃烧的金色长剑戳刺着菲利普。“你觊觎我的家园，现在你得偿所愿了！拿去吧，这都是你的了，噢，伟大的万物之王！那只羔羊......那位君王的新娘......那位通灵者，终于要迎来仪式的开启了！”

维斯拉·褐牙 (@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.JPnvn6b8xrDKst5e]{Weasel Hag}*) 的幻象在角色们进入这个冰封地下室时向他们咆哮，她唾弃她的姐姐们，声称她们对如何正确地预备献祭灵魂一无所知。如果这个鬼婆幻象受到任何伤害，她便会消失，只留下那把长剑当啷一声掉落在地。

解救菲利普。 尽管 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.3GaMIOhR2dD771fp]{Phillip Druskenvald} (绝对中立，人类非战斗贵族 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmNoble000000000]{Noble}) 被令人窒息的根须包裹、浑身是血且几乎处于僵直状态，菲利普·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德暂时并没有真正的生命危险。他的肉体是迎接角之王降临所必需的。即便角色们不攻击维斯拉，也请掷先攻！角色们解救菲利普的速度越快，他们在迎接下一地点的高潮之战前被消耗的程度就越小。

作为一个操作动作，一名角色可以通过成功进行以下任意一项DC20的属性检定来移除一根束缚菲利普的根须：

  • [[/check ATH DC 20]]{力量(运动)}，用于撕断根须

  • [[/check SLT DC 20]]{敏捷(巧手)}，用于将根须滑脱解开

  • [[/check INV DC 20]]{智力(调查)}，用于找出根须上正确的绳结以便轻易解开

  • 其他由你判定为合适的检定

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-rollable-tables.RollTable.581BXJCRlBat2RPT]{万物之王}

检定失败时，角色会失手并受到 [[/damage 4d6]]{14 (4d6)} 伤害，伤害类型取决于致伤的器具，通过在万物之王表中掷骰决定。在菲利普获释之前，无法通过任何手段将火把、苹果和王冠从他身上移除。

在六次成功的检定后，菲利普重获自由，他的王冠、苹果和火把也随之掉落在地。他恢复了神智，带着愈发恐慌的情绪立刻询问阿黛拉的下落，惊呼她刚才就在这里。他对着一个只有他能听见的声音抗议着，随后消失在一阵蓝色迷雾中，被丹妮·詹金拉出了梦魇。

冰封王座。 在先攻轮到20(先攻相同则视为后手)时，冰冷的地下室变得更加寒冷彻骨。除菲利普·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德以外的生物都必须进行一次 [[/save CON DC 15]] 豁免，豁免失败则受到 [[/damage 2d6 cold]]{11 (2d6)} 寒冷伤害并获得1 &reference[exhaustion apply=false] 级力竭。拥有寒冷伤害抗性或免疫的生物自动成功于此豁免。

万劫不复之魂。 在先攻轮到10(先攻相同则视为后手)时，亡魂风暴会锁定一名随机角色并试图附身。目标必须进行一次 [[/save CHA DC 15]] 豁免，豁免失败则会被亡魂附身，持续1分钟。被附身的角色会被强迫使用其最强大的法术或能力攻击盟友。该角色可以在其每个回合结束时重骰该豁免，豁免成功则终止附身。豁免成功的角色对此效应免疫。

歪曲之门。 菲利普消失后，一扇歪曲之门从结冰且盘根错节的根须中升起，通向最后的部分：辛苦与烦恼。

宝藏。 维斯拉·褐牙掉落的那把剑是一把 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgFlameTongue00]{焰舌} (长剑)。

Toil and Trouble.name: 辛苦与烦恼 (Toil and Trouble)
Toil and Trouble.text:
辛 苦 与 烦 恼

这扇歪曲之门是角色们穿越的最后一道门，将引领他们直抵梦魇的核心。

你们步入歪屋的阁楼，却发现这里已扭曲成了更为恐怖的模样。空间变得异常巨大，到处堆满了各种邪恶仪式的腐臭残渣。房间的墙壁上爬满了成千上万只害兽，它们如同一整块活体般起伏蠕动。房间中央，一口巨大的沸腾坩埚下长着带爪的脚，伫立在舔舐着铁壁的烈火之上。片刻之后，你们便听到了秽鸣集会那三位鬼婆刺耳的尖笑声。

刹那间，坩埚中的汤药翻滚溢出，聚合成了一个全新的形态。一只巨大的、蠕动着的怪物从那团粘液中诞生——它是维斯拉·褐牙、斯托诺佳·黑刺和葛洛柏·灰喉的融合体，身上长满了黄鼬、蜈蚣和鸽子的肢体特征。这只三首的畸变憎恶向你们发出冷笑，随即那口坩埚也开始迈步走动。

一旦抵达这歪曲阁楼，角色们便再无时间做任何准备。掷先攻！本区域的战斗使用地图22.5。

Phase 1: Sing Ye Vermin.name: 第一阶段：唱吧！害兽！ (PHASE 1: SING YE VERMIN)
Phase 1: Sing Ye Vermin.text:
Phase 1: 唱吧！害兽！

秽鸣集会鬼婆那令人作呕的残余——@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.o30xGteMCeHNfXTF]{害兽憎恶}* 发起攻击。三个头颅齐声颂扬着歪曲女王的伟大，并嘲弄角色们无力拯救注定毁灭的阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德。鬼婆们钟爱的害兽在整个房间内蜂拥而出，在地板和墙壁上疯狂蠕动爬行。鬼婆们珍爱的魔宠不断从这些害虫中重生，化作三个 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.OdqRFft4YUgIt1Cp]{害兽使魔群}*。

蠕动之墙。 除害兽憎恶和害兽使魔群外，任何位于墙壁5尺范围内的生物，在位于该距离内期间，其速度就会因密集的害兽而减半。

害兽之歌。 在战斗中，维斯拉、斯托诺佳和葛洛柏的三个头颅齐声吟唱一首邪恶的咒文，以此为她们的魔法充能。歌词如下：

土下钻掘众信使，听吾号令速回应。

凡人梦境根须缠，枯萎腐败皆凋零。

乖儿速现母相迎，慈手轻柔意含情。

抖落盲目卑贱眠，蠕行黑暗出深渊。

唱吧，害兽，齐歌唱！所见欢愉全呈上？

叫吧，害兽，齐尖叫！所得尽数皆释放！

融入汤中死气腾，只为添得一缕香！

Phase 2: Scream Ye Vermin.name: 第二阶段：叫吧！害兽！ (PHASE 2: SCREAM YE VERMIN)
Phase 2: Scream Ye Vermin.text:
Phase 2: 叫吧！害兽！

当害兽憎恶浴血时，这个憎恶会发出尖啸，驱使密集的害兽陷入狂乱。它们蔓延至阁楼的所有表面，引发以下效应：

困难地形。 对于除害兽憎恶和害兽使魔群以外的任何生物，地板、墙壁和天花板均视为困难地形。

无尽噬咬。 当除害兽憎恶或害兽使魔群以外的生物开始其回合时，必须进行一次 [[/save DEX DC 12]] 豁免，豁免失败则受到 [[/damage 2d8 piercing]]{9 (2d8)} 穿刺伤害，并陷入 &reference[poisoned apply=false] 状态，直至其回合结束。

等级提升。 当角色们摧毁害兽憎恶时，若他们仍为11级，则将提升至12级。

Conclusion: Dreaming No More.name: 结局：不再做梦 (Dreaming No More)
Conclusion: Dreaming No More.text:
结局：不再做梦

在角色们击败了害兽憎恶后，朗读或转述以下内容：

随着最后一击落下，这栋房子开始颤抖——并非出于愤怒，而是因为恐惧。现实崩塌，笼罩在你们周围的梦魇随之破碎。巨大的爆裂声在四周骤然响起，脚下的地板也随之塌陷。随着歪屋的坍塌，你们翻滚跌落，穿过一层又一层的地板直坠而下。

最终，你们躺在了无云的夜空下，身处一堆木头、灰泥和尘土之中。丹妮·詹金和小壳正低头注视着你们。数不清的精魂与灵体在坍塌的废墟周围盘旋，宛如蜂巢被毁后四散乱飞的黄蜂。有些灵体穿过丹妮的身体进进出出，而她则平静地伫立在这场由亡魂驱动的旋涡中心。

女孩开口了，语调幽远而释然：“它们不知道该去哪里。它们被困在这里太久了。现在，它们终于能找到安宁了。”

歪屋已被摧毁，亡魂们终获自由。在群魂纷乱的嘈杂声中，约瑟夫·帕特里尼的灵体在角色们面前短暂现身，向他们感激地点头致意，随即飞走重新融入了亡魂大军。

如果角色们救出了沃尔特、吉莉中的任意一人或两人，他们将会和丹妮以及小壳一起出现在歪屋的废墟中。然而，据他们所说，菲利普·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德刚被拉出梦魇，便立即冲了出去，动身去寻找阿黛拉了。

当角色们站稳脚跟时，詹金一家相拥而泣，但还有更多信息需要分享。利用以下信息来引导对话：

  • 莎莉·洛克伍德的灵魂从小壳体内获释，小壳变回了一只普通的狗。莎莉分享了她家族灭亡的故事（见第十二章），以及她是如何试图阻止悲剧重演却最终失败的经历。

  • 丹妮知道亡魂们之所以躁动不安，是因为它们能感觉到一股可怕的力量正在荒野上滋长。那正是菲利普和阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德此刻的所在地。她能感应到他们在那里。

  • 如果角色们救出了她的双亲，丹妮灵魂中那无法抑制的喜悦与释然将感染众人。角色们获得长休的增益。如果他们只救出了一位家长，则获得短休的增益。

命运塔罗占卜。 如果在第九章的命运塔罗占卜中抽到了皇后牌，则可以在歪屋的瓦砾中发现 @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.ewNarZMSfQvM4CXa]{秽鸣集会的坩埚}*。

重返柳沼村

柳沼村已陷入一片混乱。潜伏在旧途信众中的狂热分子已采取行动，启动了在罗温高丘——位于柳沼村以北荒野中的最高峰——顶端献祭阿黛拉·德鲁斯肯瓦尔德及无数无辜者的仪式。

随着柳条人的建造完工，来自谷地各处的邪教徒戴上怪诞的动物面具，袭击了柳沼村。他们从街道和家中绑架受害者，将他们拖入荒野之中。哪些NPC已经堕落加入了邪教徒的行列，又有哪些正面临被献祭的风险，这些都由你来决定，以此来推高后续事件的戏剧张力（见第二十三章）。

Chapter 26: Moonfall.name: 第26章 - 月陨
Chapter 26: Moonfall.text:
Chapter 26:

Moonfall

“The moon knows you, stranger. It has been waiting since the first stone was laid, since the first bone was buried. She comes to claim what was promised. And if you meet her mad gaze, it’s too late-they’ve already chosen you.”

- Rowan -

The horrors the characters have overcome were merely a prelude to the nightmare that now looms over Wickermoor Hollow. Though Kehlenn’s influence has been severed from the land, her imprisonment within the Crooked Moon above did not put an end to her primeval power. The defeated archfey seeks her final revenge: the total destruction of the realm she once ruled. Her leering gaze settles on Wickermoor Hollow for the last time, awakening eight ancient beings of immense power to bring the moon crashing down upon Druskenvald, destroying everyone and everything within.

With Kehlenn’s defeat at the Crooked Tree, a fragile peace has settled over Wickermoor Hollow, but it is a peace born of fear and uncertainty. Even in the face of victory, the people of the valley have been forever changed by the horrors that have occurred over the past weeks and months. While many inhabitants of the valley may not know the events that occurred in the Wytchwood and how close the Horned King came to annihilating them, they all soon learn of the new doom descending from above.

The moon’s grin has curled into a sneer as it wakes eight eons-old powers still tethered to the land. With the promise of a transformation of the domain into their own image, these mythic beings call the moon down from the night sky to eventually crash into Wickermoor Hollow. The resulting cataclysm would destroy the whole of Druskenvald and remake it as Kehlenn and her champions see fit. The characters must act quickly, or all they have fought to save will be lost with the moon’s apocalyptic embrace.

Endgame

This optional chapter offers guidance for leading level 13 characters to the pinnacle of 20th level, providing the inspiration to craft challenging and harrowing encounters that will test their might and resolve. This chapter is aimed at tables that favor epic tiers of play and want to experience grandiose stakes of high fantasy.

If you wish to continue the campaign after the main events of The Crooked Moon, this chapter presents a flexible framework that challenges players while maintaining the unsettling dread central to folk horror. If you plan on following this path, the characters should not reach level 14 after defeating the Horned King. Instead, each character increases one ability score of their choice by 2. This increase can’t raise a score above 24.

Characters who seek to prevent Kehlenn’s final vengeance have the following goals:

  • Seek out each of the eight awakened powers of Wickermoor Hollow.

  • Destroy them and sever their tether to the Crooked Moon.

  • Banish Kehlenn to the Crooked Moon for all time.

Many of the specifics of how the characters embark on this final adventure will be up to you to decide. If the adventure incorporated Fateweaving (see chapter 9), you must decide how the various climaxes and catharses of the characters would affect the events presented in this chapter.

The Moon is Falling.name: 月陨 (The Moon is Falling)
The Moon is Falling.text:
The Moon is Falling

One terrible night, the Crooked Moon lets out a horrific shriek and speaks with Kehlenn’s voice, delivering a message that echoes across Wickermoor Hollow: the moon shall fall, and doom will come in thirteen nights. Slowly but surely, the moon begins to grow larger in the sky as it descends toward the valley.

The inhabitants of Wickermoor Hollow react in a variety of ways—some turn to panic, others to prayer, and surprisingly, many resign themselves to the end. However, most are too preoccupied with the destructive effects of the eight evils that have risen and the horrors they’ve unleashed upon the land. This development will stress or empower the relationships that the characters have nurtured during their time in Wickermoor Hollow.

Impending Doom

The characters must now hunt down these emerging evils, racing against time as each victory delays the moon’s fall—but not its inevitable approach. Further, every moment wasted allows the once-dormant threats to grow in power and cause mass destruction ahead of the impending apocalypse.

Countdown to Extinction

As soon as the Crooked Moon begins falling, it will crash into Wickermoor Hollow in exactly thirteen nights. If this occurs, the resulting collision and explosion of primordial energy annihilates the entirety of Druskenvald, including the characters if they are still within the realm when the moon makes impact. This ends the campaign.

Achieving Victory. The only way to prevent Druskenvald’s downfall is to kill all eight of the ancient evils bound to Wickermoor Hollow and reject Kehlenn’s final bargain. This returns the Crooked Moon to its rightful place in the sky and ensures that the Crooked Queen is powerless forever.

Tracking Time. As each of the thirteen nights progresses, keep track of how many nights are left before the inevitable collision. Clearly describe to the players that the moon is growing larger in the sky and its face is growing more menacing. Also, consider how the people of the valley act in the face of a seemingly inevitable death.

Delaying the Inevitable. Each time one of the ancient evils is slain, the descent of the moon stops for 24 hours. This means that if the characters continually kill the powerful enemies before them, they have a full twenty nights to stop the doom.

Turn Back Time. If you wish to give the characters additional time or believe they have earned help, the Vagrant arrives right before the collision and aids them. He plays a powerful song on his fiddle that turns back time 72 hours, buying the characters three additional nights. Due to the timeless nature of the ancient evils, any of them killed before or during this reverted time remain dead.

The Old Fears

Eight fearsome beings bound to the land of Wickermoor Hollow stir and rise to power, having felt the gaze of the Crooked Moon upon them. Imbued with Kehlenn’s primordial energies, they have exchanged their own ties to Wickermoor Hollow so that the moon can continue to plummet toward a cataclysm with the promise to remake the realm in their own image. They are as follows:

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.cHU2ledbj9sUQ5Eq]{The Galloping Headsman}. A headless phantom of fiery wrath driven by revenge.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.LMsz0Wec48jVB1a9]{The White Worm}. An eldritch being from beyond the stars that feasts on memories.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.YlLuWhpb0HwH9nzA]{The Tall Man}. A twisted and corrupted archfey that stalks the woods for victims.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.fCG5qm0hX4DtsndY]{The Wild Titan}. A gigantic manifestation of the wilds that seeks to unleash savagery.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Jl4mI8O0O6D9pLuV]{The Barrow King}. A long-dead king seeking glory who commands Undead legions.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.7rdR1klh875p8ABz]{The Jinxed Leviathan}. An enormous swamp beast imbued with the essence of bad luck.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.z190J9aT9xcdLXhF]{The Dusk Mother}. A tormented spirit of loss that spreads her misery to all.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.ZpqpWxE5kzFjsW72]{The Brimstone Behemoth}. A volcanic colossus of hellfire that ushers in armageddon.

The characters must defeat these legendary creatures in order, each one more powerful than the last, if they hope to save Druskenvald. The subsequent sections of this chapter feature the eight ancient evils, including the following tools to craft an exhilarating adventure for each:

  • A quest hook that points the characters in the direction of the ancient evil.

  • The effects of the legendary creature’s presence on the land, which are in addition to its lair features (see appendix A).

  • How the locals are tormented, affected, and corrupted by it.

  • What types of monsters and minions that might serve it.

  • The circumstances of the final showdown with the powerful being.

  • How the afflicted people react to the destruction of the creature.

The Galloping Headsman.name: 疾驰刽子手 (The Galloping Headsman)
The Galloping Headsman.text:
The Galloping Headsman

Centuries ago, a centaur served as an executioner to the people who first founded Foxwillow. Due to corruption at the highest levels of the town’s leadership, this headsman was falsely accused of murder, dragged through an unjust trial, and beheaded before the whole town. While its townsfolk exclaimed justice, the blood that spilled on the soil bound the centaur’s spirit to the fields. With the power of the Crooked Moon, the Galloping Headsman thunders through the farmland, seeking justice against his killers’ descendants, whipping them up in a frenzy of paranoia that spelled his doom so many years ago.

Hysteria in Foxwillow

The distrust sown by the secrets revealed during the Harvest Terror’s attack has boiled into all-out conflict, plunging the farming community into mass hysteria. A farmer from the town seeks out the characters and tells them that neighbor has turned against neighbor, and folks are being condemned to death by beheading. The executioner is rumored to be a spirit of fiery wrath that rides to meet each of the condemned, lops off their heads, and adds them to its collection.

Fields of Vengeance

The fertile farmland around Foxwillow—so easily corrupted by the demonic influence of Raum—craves vengeance and has come to life under the ghastly influence of the Galloping Headsman.

Stone Pressing. The earth itself opens up, attempting to swallow the accused and crush them with the stones within. For every mile traveled, characters must succeed on a [[/save STR DC 17]] saving throw or fall into a sinkhole and have the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition. While Restrained in this way, a character takes [[/damage 1d8 bludgeoning]]{4 (1d8)} Bludgeoning damage at the start of each of their turns. A Restrained character repeats the save at the end of each of their turns, freeing themself on a success.

Choking Crops. The crops attempt to choke the life out of the wicked. The first time a character enters any field that bears crops, its roots, stalks, or vines attempt to strangle the character. They must succeed on a [[/save STR DC 17]] saving throw or gain the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition for 1 minute (escape DC 15). While Grappled in this way, the character gains 1 &reference[exhaustion apply=false] level at the end of each of their turns. A character who can't be Charmed succeeds automatically. The crops have AC 5; HP 10; Vulnerability to Fire damage; Immunity to Bludgeoning and Psychic damage.

Mob Injustice

When the characters arrive at the Foxwillow Farmland, they find its people are Hostile to them, accusing them of witchcraft, murder, sabotage, and of causing the incoming apocalypse. Some cunning townsfolk even attempt to act as friends to earn their trust before turning them over to frenzied mobs.

Vengeful Wrath. The wrathful emotion of the Galloping Headsman spreads like a virulent plague. Whenever a character comes within 20 feet of a Foxwillow villager, the character must succeed on a [[/save CHA DC 17]] saving throw or lose the ability to distinguish friend from foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies. On a success, the character is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

Wandering Mob. Roving gangs of vigilantes hunt the characters in the hopes of capturing, imprisoning, trying, and executing them. Every 1 hour that the characters spend within 1 mile of the town center of Foxwillow, they must succeed on a group DC 17 Dexterity (Stealth) check or be detected and attacked by 20 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmTough000000000]{Toughs}.

All Hallows’ Evil

The emergence of the Galloping Headsman has twisted the Foxwillow farmland’s flora, fauna, and people, and it has awakened monstrous creatures with a burning vengeance:

Vengeful Spirits. The Headsman has riled up the spirits of the dead that faced wrongful deaths and seek retribution. These take the form of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmCentaurTrooper]{Centaur Troopers} (Undead), @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.TPVllYMGvILDeOUR]{Kackles}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.2DjyTy5dhbhH5Fyf]{Phantom Hearses}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Plgibu7fguyYVcTG]{Pumpkin Heads}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.aEPVMByT2COU30KF]{Wayward Haints}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWillowisp00000]{Will-o-Wisps}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWraith00000000]{Wraiths}.

Monsters of the Fields. Livestock and scavenger birds have been twisted by the Headsman’s vengeful fury. These take the form of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmCockatrice0000]{Cockatrices}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.9qrckgonmfCl6Vsx]{Corvodaemons}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.CwhH1UpLfAWahAes]{Crowstorms}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.YanMa8w09aAgP7oZ]{Drakkenhobs}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.fuJHMByh1BJraTQi]{Gobblegeists}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGorgon00000000]{Gorgons}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmMinotaurOfBaph]{Minotaurs}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmNightmare00000]{Nightmares}.

Vengeance’s Reckoning

Some townsfolk whisper of a shadowy figure that looks like a rider on horseback but joined as one. They revere this being as an angel of judgment, punishing their town for the wickedness of their neighbors. The characters must learn where they can find this spirit to put an end to the mass hysteria.

Tarnished History. The characters can investigate Foxwillow to learn about the village’s dark past. If the characters succeed on a group [[/check HIS DC 17]] or [[/check INV DC 17]] check, they learn the headsman’s story and that he was beheaded before the covered bridge to the east of town toward the edge of Wickermoor Hollow.

Bloody Trail. The characters can tail a mob as it dispenses its “justice” or even infiltrate its ranks with a successful group [[/check STE DC 17]] or [[/check DEC DC 17]] check to witness the attempted execution of a falsely accused villager.

The Headless Horseman

Characters who arrive at the covered bridge can lure out the vengeful spirit with the offering of the execution of a Foxwillow local or by inciting its warped sense of justice. @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.cHU2ledbj9sUQ5Eq]{Galloping Headsman}* rides out from the darkness of the bridge’s cover and charges the characters, seeking to behead them all and slake its never-ending thirst for vengeance.

Reckoning’s End. With the Galloping Headsman’s destruction, the town is freed from his oppressive judgment. The people of Foxwillow gain clarity and realize that they must aid their neighbors in these final nights. Grateful to the characters, they decide to spend their final hours feasting and celebrating instead of falling to despair. The Crooked Moon shifts, its gaze turning toward Moonsong Lake.

Level Up. The characters reach level 14, if they are still level 13, when they destroy the Galloping Headsman.

Fabled Heirloom. The @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.LKfTErToFGGZOOFE]{Axe of the Galloping Headsman}* is left behind after the vengeful spirit is destroyed.

The White Worm.name: 白虫 (The White Worm)
The White Worm.text:
The White Worm

A once unfathomable horror from a forgotten reality beyond the stars, the eldritch entity known as the White Worm was pulled through the veil by the rituals of Matron Lethica (see chapter 17). Imprisoned for many years beneath Memory’s Rest Sanatorium, it feasted upon the memories of the hospital’s patients before escaping into the depths of Moonsong Lake. After recovering from its long torment and being fed countless ancient memories by the Crooked Moon, it has undergone a metamorphosis into its true form as a cosmic horror. It now ravenously hungers for the memories of Druskenvald until the land itself is forgotten.

A Feast for Worms

Moonsong Lake is infested with worms. These parasites slither through the water supply and infect the people who live upon its shores. Memories are devoured, personalities are reshaped, and bodies are contorted into horrific abominations of alien biology. A member of a small fishing village approaches the characters and begs them to end the infestation and restore the identities of the mindless victims.

Lake of the White Worm

The waters of Moonsong Lake and its estuary are tainted with alien parasites that sap memories, feeding them to the White Worm and spawning more thralls for the hivemind.

Water of Forgetfulness. Any character who drinks from the water of Moonsong Lake, or any well, river, or stream within 5 miles of it, must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 17]] saving throw or have the & reference[poisoned apply=false] condition for 8 hours. While Poisoned in this way, the character loses all memories from before the moment they drank the water. A character who succeeds on this save is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

Parasite Found. Any character immersed in the water of Moonsong Lake must succeed on a [[/save CON DC 17]] saving throw or be infected with a spawn of the White Worm. Unless the character receives a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration} spell or similar magic, they transform into a @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.WqgtgXOTMpVi5JIj]{Wormhost Surgeon}* in 7 days.

A Strange Folk

When the characters arrive on the shores of Moonsong Lake, they find the fishing villages filled with folk who are oddly at peace with the coming doom. Some sit catatonically with no recollection of who they are or who they once were. Those who have not forgotten their memories are secretly Hostile to the characters and seek to turn them into thralls of the White Worm.

Cult of the Worm. White Worm cultists cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDominatePe]{Dominate Person} (DC 17) on any character who is alone with them.

Shattered Psyche. The minds of those who have forgotten themselves are filled with oblivion. Any character who uses magic to attempt to read a villager’s thoughts or look into their mind must succeed on a [[/save INT DC 17]] saving throw or be affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.hYCrN82dMJFuJODB]{Feeblemind} spell.

Things From Beyond

The reawakening of the White Worm has twisted the minds of the lake’s denizens to her alien will, and a tear to its home reality has opened at the bottom of the lake, unleashing unspeakable things into the dark water.

Deep Dwellers. The creatures that lurk in the depths of Moonsong Lake and are influenced by the great memory devourer include @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGiantCrab00000]{Giant Crabs}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGiantToad00000]{Giant Toads}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGiantOctopus00]{Giant Octopi}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmHydra000000000]{Hydras}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.AOoXC7NvOZy8bztM]{Lake Dredgers}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmPlesiosaurus00]{Plesiosauruses}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.KXG5XLIwKhn1V0Y5]{Swarms of Quippers}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.jjwL3WWVhUJ9SmkZ]{Wellwyrms}*, and worm swarms (use the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmSwarmOfVenomou]{Swarm of Venomous Snakes} stat block).

Alien Invaders. Entities from beyond the stars drift through the veil into Druskenvald. These take the form of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmAboleth0000000]{Aboleths}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmChuul000000000]{Chuuls}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmCloaker0000000]{Cloakers}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGibberingMouth]{Gibbering Mouthers}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.grit0JinU8cmNnSN]{Invaders Out of Space}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.xn8fdH3xobiXuf10]{Mutant Nurses}*, and @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.WqgtgXOTMpVi5JIj]{Wormhost Surgeons}*.

The Hunger Below

The people of the lakeside babble and sometimes shriek of the “thing in the lake” and its unending hunger that seeks to consume all memory of Druskenvald. Rumors of ancient ruins built by the original denizens of the lake hold the key to the creature’s origin and goal. The characters must find the tear in reality at the bottom of the lake to restore memory to the people.

Black Obelisks. The characters can search for ancient ruins of the original lake dwellers. After locating the ruins, they can study the carvings. With a successful [[/check ARC DC 17]] or [[/check INV DC 17]] check, the characters learn of the White Worm's origin and the signs to find it.

Into the Cult. The characters can feign interest in willfully joining the esoteric order that worships the White Worm with a successful group [[/check DEC DC 17]] or [[/check PER DC 17]], learning its secrets.

The Eldritch Horror

Characters who find a way to brave the water and survive its crushing depths find reality and their minds warp the deeper they delve. Once they discover the tear into the long-forgotten reality, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.LMsz0Wec48jVB1a9]{The White Worm}* emerges into the black water and attempts to devour the characters in both body and mind.

Remembering Once More. With the destruction of the White Worm, its tether to Druskenvald is broken, and its essence is ripped into the tear in reality as the rift seals forever. The parasitic worms wither and die, and the water becomes clean once more. The people around the lake regain their memories, though many wish they hadn’t, for now they are gripped with the terror of their inevitable doom. The Crooked Moon, ever closer, looks to Hartsblight Forest.

Level Up. The characters reach level 15, if they are still level 14, when they destroy the White Worm.

Fabled Heirloom. The @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.IAKTIfQVP5O1tcvI]{Eye of the White Worm}* can be claimed as a grotesque trophy from the withered corpse.

The Tall Man.name: 畸爪高影 (The Tall Man)
The Tall Man.text:
The Tall Man

Once a slender and agile archfey of the Greenwood who danced to the music of the forest, the Tall Man was twisted and rotted into an empty husk of his former self. Now, he silently lurks within the shadows between the trees. Emboldened by the Crooked Moon, he seeks to lure unsuspecting travelers to the woods so he may stalk his prey in a wicked game of cat and mouse. Once his prey is immobilized by terror, he uses his huge, gnarled fingers to snatch them up and dine on their flesh, made all the more delectable by their fear.

Terror Between the Trees

Wicked things lurk in the recovering woods of Hartsblight Forest. The shadows grow long as the moon draws nearer, and the people nearest to the forest’s edge are consumed by waking nightmares and entranced by dancing shadows that lure them into the thicket. Members of a small logging settlement seek out the characters and ask for help finding those who are missing.

Where Shadows Reign

With the destruction of Gorthos and the empowerment of the Crooked Moon, the Tall Man has made Hartsblight Forest his domain of terror, creating the ideal hunting grounds for the horrifying archfey and his corrupted court.

Fear of the Dark. For every hour of travel through Hartsblight Forest, each character must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 18]] saving throw or have Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls for 8 hours. A creature that can't be Frightened succeeds automatically.

Trick of Shadows. Throughout Hartsblight Forest, shadowy silhouettes of the Tall Man linger between the trees. Characters who move within 10 feet of these silhouettes are attacked by four @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.IUQV4JufNAkxzlqW]{Lurkers in the Dark}*.

Easy Prey

When the characters arrive at the settlements near the forest’s edge, they are greeted by horrified shrieks and find the communities mostly empty. Those that remain are Indifferent toward the characters and can't rip themselves from their waking nightmares. Any who suffer these nightmares wander into the woods and become lost.

Fear and Panic. Whenever the characters find a missing villager in the forest, the villager soon begins to scream in terror, drawing the attention of the Tall Man or his minions, unless the characters calm them with a successful group [[/check DEC DC 18]] or [[/check PER DC 18]] check.

Lost and Alone. Voices of the lost cry out to the characters, but the forest distorts their location. For every hour of travel through Hartsblight Forest, the characters must succeed on a group [[/check PRC DC 18]] or [[/check SUR DC 18]] check or spend the next 3 hours wandering through the woods, making no progress, and not finding the lost villager.

Court of Fear and Shadow

With newfound dominion over the forest, all of the dark wood serve the Tall Man, whether they be the denizens of the forest once blighted by Gorthos or the vicious members of his fey court.

Rotten Hearts. The denizens of Hartsblight Forest now dance with the Tall Man, including @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmDeathDog000000]{Death Dogs}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.HWnMB1dpNqJ23kCH]{Festerhulks}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGiantElk000000]{Giant Elks} (Undead), @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.ecqI3lBTgVoykPwV]{Gloomwoods}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.nyRSwRnMCTM1oEgG]{Hypnovulfen}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.nb9XWuiJS6wzHpqX]{Keepers of the Blight}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmOwlbear0000000]{Owlbears}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.OezNlGyvTzCD5rHX]{Rotweavers}*, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmTreant00000000]{Treants}.

Bumps in the Night. The corrupted members of the fallen fey court serve their lord’s twisted appetites, taking the form of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmDryad000000000]{Dryads}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGreenHag000000]{Green Hags}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.saFBY6zjByhqHaie]{Heralds of Fools}* (Fey), @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.N6ttfwgb1ckMzfST]{Ketgrinn}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.IUQV4JufNAkxzlqW]{Lurkers in the Dark}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.NrmpoRZNFXkLJfzU]{Revelers of Song}* (Fey), @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.F3ApumBtvfzeKLR6]{Revelers of Stories}* (Fey), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmSprite00000000]{Sprites}.

Stalker in Darkness

The screeching villagers consumed by waking nightmares rave about the man between the trees, who dwells in his ruined palace of murk and misery. Rumors of the forgotten fey folk of the Greenwood are whispered by a few who know of the lithe dancing lord before he fell to rot. The characters must find his palace or lure him out to put an end to his reign of terror.

Fear in Folktales. The characters may seek out the folklore of these settlements, finding an old crone who knows of the Tall Man’s story and his palace if they succeed on a group [[/check ARC DC 18]] or [[/check PER DC 18]] check.

Hunting the Hunter. The characters can track and lure out the Tall Man with a successful group [[/check SUR DC 18]] check if they use fear to draw his attention.

The Slender One

Whether the characters discover the ruined palace or attempt to lure the withered archfey to them, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.YlLuWhpb0HwH9nzA]{The Tall Man}* knows of their coming and stalks them for hours before finally striking when the creeping dread is at its most intense.

Face Your Fears. When the Tall Man is slain, his body breaks and crumbles like dry bark, and the looming moon’s light pierces the canopy of the woodland once more as the terror lifts. Having been consumed by fear for so long, the denizens of the forest's edge can't find it in them to dread their coming deaths, and they go about their business as if nothing happened. The Crooked Moon turns to the Howlers, its light growing colder as it seeks its next champion.

Level Up. The characters reach level 16, if they are still level 15, when they destroy the Tall Man.

Fabled Heirloom. The @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.E6Yc8BYtNL3EKRiA]{Hook of the Tall Man}* can be claimed by removing a finger from the butchered archfey.

The Wild Titan.name: 蛮荒泰坦 (The Wild Titan)
The Wild Titan.text:
The Wild Titan

Created long ago by some unknown will for a purpose now lost to time, the Wild Titan is the wilderness made flesh. It once wandered the remote peaks of the Howlers, the mountain chain that makes up the western border of Wickermoor Hollow, following the rune stones of its creator after the creature lost all contact. As the centuries passed, its long, heavy strides became more of a struggle, and it grew weary from its aimlessness. And so, it slumbered until the Crooked Moon instilled the beast with primal fury, the very essence of its creation. Now, it seeks to bring the mountains down upon civilization and unleash the bestial savagery within all mortal beings.

Primal Rage

Savage howls and frigid wind echo through the mountains as colossal boulders crash upon the settlements below. A feral violence has erupted among the communities nestled in the foothills of the Howlers. Some have even lost their humanity as they transform into monsters. A miner from Dawn’s Gate who lost his family to these transformations pleads for the characters to bring an end to the wrath of the wilds.

The Rumbling

The looming, frigid mountain range of the Howlers is treacherous, but now it stands as a monument to unbound wilderness, as if the mountains themselves seek the destruction of civilized life.

Rocks Fall. Whether cast down by the Wild Titan or the mountains themselves, crashing stone tumbles from icy peaks. For every mile traveled within 1 mile of the Howlers, the characters must succeed on a [[/save DEX DC 18]] saving throw or take [[/damage 6d6 bludgeoning]]{21 (6d6)} Bludgeoning damage and [[/damage 4d6 cold]]{14 (4d6)} Cold damage.

Make No Fire. The harsh elements make it impossible for travelers to benefit from the warmth of fire. Within 5 miles of the Howlers, open flames, including torches and bonfires, are snuffed out instantly, and all Fire damage is halved.

The Beasts Within

When the characters arrive at Dawn’s Gate or any of the mining settlements at the base of the Howlers, they find rampant destruction and few buildings standing. Grunting townsfolk incapable of speech attack on sight and try to devour flesh. Even more dreadful are the hairy monsters that still linger on the fringes of the communities and drag screaming victims into the wilderness.

Going Berserk. Whenever a character comes within 10 feet of a villager afflicted with primal wrath or starts a turn there, they must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 18]] saving throw or go berserk until the start of their next turn, perceiving all creatures as enemies. While berserk, on each of their turns, a character must move to the nearest creature and take the Attack action against it. Characters who succeed on the saving throw are immune to this effect for 24 hours.

Titan’s Roar. Strange roars bellow from the mountains. Every hour while within 1 mile of a settlement, each character must succeed on a [[/save CHA DC 18]] saving throw or gain one Mark of the Wild Titan. When a character reaches three of these marks, they instantly transform into an @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.UefYwNtXs9J5eKya]{Alpengrendel}*. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]{Remove Curse} spell removes one or two accumulated marks.

Where the Wild Things Are

The untamed wilderness where the Wild Titan roams is filled with ferocious predators incensed by the howling of the hairy colossus. These include ravenous beasts and primeval entities drawn by the runestones that dot the peaks.

Menacing Menagerie. The creatures of the Howlers have gone berserk with the urge to destroy anything civilized, including @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.UefYwNtXs9J5eKya]{Alpengrendel}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmBehir000000000]{Behir}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.bdayUVvMhDxmeOI6]{Boneflayers}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmDireWolf000000]{Dire Wolves}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGiantApe000000]{Giant Apes}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmMammoth0000000]{Mammoths}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmPolarBear00000]{Polar Bears}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmOgre0000000000]{Ogres}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmRemorhaz000000]{Remorhazes}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmRoc00000000000]{Rocs}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmTroll000000000]{Trolls} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWinterWolf0000]{Winter Wolves}.

Spirits of the Wild. The ancient runestones of the Howlers call forth beings of the wild. These take the form of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmEarthElemental]{Earth Elementals}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmFrostGiant0000]{Frost Giants} (Elemental), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGargoyle000000]{Gargoyles}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmIceMephit00000]{Ice Mephits}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmStoneGiant0000]{Stone Giants} (Elemental), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmStoneGolem0000]{Stone Golems}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.WqTPP2mqg3KIUiyr]{Wildpyres}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.dOhRNPrLYYSPJf2S]{Woodwarped}*, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmXorn0000000000]{Xorn}.

Attack on the Titan

The constant rumbling of the mountain crashing into the valley below and the howling of savage monsters cause the survivors and the villagers who remain to believe that the spirit of the mountain itself wishes to destroy them before the Crooked Moon does. Some, however, remember the tales of the titan that walks the peaks and the stones it uses as a guide, and the most cunning or desperate trackers are willing to sacrifice everything to bring an end to the titan’s assault.

In the Runes. The characters can follow the clues left in the runestones along the mountainside. A successful group [[/check HIS DC 18]] or [[/check NAT DC 18]] check allows the characters to discover the Wild Titan’s story and the path that it treads through the Howlers.

Dangerous Game. The characters encounter a grizzled hunter with a relentless dedication to kill the Wild Titan as a final triumph. A successful group [[/check SUR DC 18]] check aids him in finding his quarry through wilderness tracking.

The Abominable Wildman

When the characters make the ascent to the peaks of the Howlers and find the path of the wandering giant, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.fCG5qm0hX4DtsndY]{The Wild Titan}* makes the approach deadly with an onslaught of rockslides and avalanches. It is prepared for a brutal battle for survival, issuing a bellowing challenge and seeking to crush all civilized beings beneath its enormous feet.

Harder the Fall. When the Wild Titan is slain, it lets out a mournful roar, having never discovered its purpose or the reason for its creation, before tumbling down the mountain like a boulder. The settlements among the foothills, especially Dawn’s Gate, regain their senses. Despite the looming apocalypse, they immediately start rebuilding their crumbled communities. The Crooked Moon shifts once again, its baleful stare focusing now on Maidenmist Cemetery.

Level Up. The characters reach level 17, if they are still level 16, when they destroy the Wild Titan.

Fabled Heirloom. The @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.9fnACYOobcwZkFiY]{Runestone of the Wild Titan}* can be found near the site of the battle once the beast has been cast off the mountain.

The Barrow King.name: 荒冢之王 (The Barrow King)
The Barrow King.text:
The Barrow King

None living know the origin of the long-dead monarch entombed in the grand barrow of Maidenmist Cemetery (see chapter 19), but legends of his undying army of wights, immense necromantic might, and unmatched combat prowess are told in hushed tones around campfires or the corners of taverns. Even the unrelenting primordial element of death condensed in the Shroud seeks to corrupt this ruler, but his tomb proved too impenetrable. Now, with the Crooked Moon casting its sight upon the endless graves, the one known as the Barrow King has risen to conquer a new kingdom of the dead.

Death Reigns Here

The graves of Maidenmist Cemetery burst open, and the shambling dead rise to join the undying legions of the Barrow King as he prepares for a bloody conquest of the living, many of whom submit to the awesome necromantic power. Every night, the army of death grows and pledges sword, bow, and axe to their monarch. An inhabitant of Wickermoor Village rushes to the characters, claiming they are the last line of defense against the march of death.

All the World’s a Grave

The land itself floods with necromantic power as the graveyard of Maidenmist spreads beyond its cold iron fence. The earth churns, graves open up, decay of living matter quickens, and a dense, shroud-infused fog rolls across the valley.

Death and Decay. Any healing within 10 miles of Maidenmist Cemetery is halved.

Draining Shroud. The dense fog saps the lifeforce from the living. For every hour spent within 10 miles of Maidenmist Cemetery, the characters must succeed on a [[/save CON DC 19]] saving throw or gain 1 Exhaustion level. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDeathWard0]{Death Ward}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicCircl]{Magic Circle}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbEvilAndGoodPr]{Protection from Evil and Good} spell prevents this Exhaustion.

The Scourge of the Damned

The Barrow King’s influence spreads across the land, converting enthralled townsfolk into loyal cultists that advance his aims, Further, a plague rips through settlements that leaves its victims as mindless walking corpses.

Death Cults. Any villager encountered by the characters after the Barrow King rises has a 50 percent chance of being a member of a necrotic cult, which can be deduced with a successful [[/check INS DC 19]] check. These cultists attempt to guide the characters to their death or infect them with necrotic plague.

Necrotic Pestilence. A magical contagion spreads through the population of Wickermoor Hollow. Whenever a character ends their turn within 5 feet of an infected creature, they must succeed on a [[/save CON DC 19]] saving throw or have the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition. While Poisoned in this way, the character takes [[/damage 2d12 necrotic]]{13 (2d12)} Necrotic damage at the end of every hour, which decreases their hit point maximum by the same amount. If a character is killed by the plague, their corpse rises as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWight000000000]{Wight} 8 hours later.

Call the Banners

The Barrow King commands endless legions of Undead that gather in masses of corpse and spirit, preparing for their inevitable march upon the land. They are joined by twisted monsters bound to the monarch’s will.

Army of the Dead. The living dead form most of the Barrow King’s forces, including @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGhast000000000]{Ghasts}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.TPVllYMGvILDeOUR]{Kackles}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmMummy000000000]{Mummies}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.eu7S5GyKBSigfsnb]{Night Creatures}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.2DjyTy5dhbhH5Fyf]{Phantom Hearses}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.LmakrDSQemeBWTj2]{Shrouded}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmSpecter0000000]{Specters}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmVampireSpawn00]{Vampire Spawn}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWight000000000]{Wights}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWraith00000000]{Wraiths}.

Horde of Domination. Monstrous creatures of the night also serve the Barrow King, taking the form of @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.v1WqqEPtBHN6w2V4]{Bat Hounds}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.bdayUVvMhDxmeOI6]{Boneflayers}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmDeathDog000000]{Death Dogs}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.CgbJgAILFFyH25Oi]{Fleshdobbins}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmHellHound00000]{Hell Hounds}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.VD2zf9hF09e4GuC2]{Necrolisks}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmNightHag000000]{Night Hags}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmPhaseSpider000]{Phase Spiders}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.OezNlGyvTzCD5rHX]{Rotweavers}* (Monstrosity), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmVrock000000000]{Vrocks}.

Wrath of the Barrow King

As a plague tears through the valley and the sinister cult grows more influential, the people begin to resign themselves to a fate of undeath. The only way to destroy the monarch is by infiltrating his tomb, and knowledge of such a thing is nearly lost to Druskenvald. Only the dead hold such secrets.

Grim History. By exhuming graves and tombs throughout Maidenmist Cemetery, characters can discover how to breach the royal barrow with a successful group [[/check ARC DC 19]]. or [[/check HIS DC 19]] check.

Ghostly Communion. Spirits of the tortured dead still linger, some not entirely under the dominion of the Barrow King. A successful group [[/check PER DC 19]] check when communing with such a spirit convinces a long-dead ghost to reveal their secrets.

Kill the King

Entering the royal tomb, the characters find that the stone has given way, and a network of catacombs and crypts winds deep into the earth, surging with the living dead. In the bowels of this subterranean fortress, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Jl4mI8O0O6D9pLuV]{The Barrow King}* awaits the interlopers on a grand throne of skulls. He rises to meet the battle head-on, fighting with overwhelming necromantic power and grave honor.

End of an Empire. When the Barrow King is defeated, his army of the dead collapses into piles of desiccated flesh and bone. The royal barrow and the catacombs beneath it collapse, and the spread of death comes to an end. The people of Wickermoor Village recover from the plague and turn to the Old Ways, performing numerous strange rituals to prevent the coming doom. The Crooked Moon looks northward to the Drowned Crossroads.

Level Up. The characters reach level 18, if they are still level 17, when they destroy the Barrow King.

Fabled Heirloom. The crumbled remains of the monarch wear the @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.xbrZG9oNY8aXv54H]{Crown of the Barrow King}*.

The Jinxed Leviathan.name: 厄难巨鳄 (The Jinxed Leviathan)
The Jinxed Leviathan.text:
The Jinxed Leviathan

Long ago, a simple alligator was captured by a cabal of jinxcraft-practicing magicians that poured hexes into it, creating an enormous swamp beast fused with bad luck itself, all in hopes of defeating the powerful death spirit known as Snake Eye Jack (see chapter 15). However, this misfortune fell upon the Jinxed Leviathan’s captors when it broke free from their spell and devoured every last one of them, disappearing into the darkest tangled reaches of the Drowned Crossroads. Now, with the gaze of the Crooked Moon upon it, this reptilian colossus has risen to the surface once more, bringing misfortune and death to all those in its path.

Get Jinxed

A terrible hex afflicts the Drowned Crossroads, bringing nothing but misfortune to its people. Horrible accidents, sudden sicknesses, and shocking disappearances occur by the hour, and even the simplest tasks can bring about a gruesome death. A resident of Murkwater Bend approaches the party, claiming that things are far worse than the jinxcraft of Mister Crossroads and begging for salvation before the swamp community’s luck runs out.

Mire of Mishaps

With the terrible jinx upon the Drowned Crossroads, every inch of the swamp is treacherous, with the bayou itself animated and twisted into a strange, glowing mockery of what it once was.

The Worst Luck. A jinx afflicts the swamp. When a character makes a D20 Test, it must subtract [[/r 1d4]] from the total.

Swamplights. Eerie, jinxed hues radiate from patches of water, plants, and mud throughout the swamp. For every hour spent in the bayou, the characters must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 19]] saving throw or be affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConfusion0]{Confusion} spell for 10 minutes. If one or more characters fail the save, a @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.iXXg49tXUKWxehi9]{Bayou Beast}* rises from the swamp and attacks.

Poor Unfortunate Souls

The people of the Drowned Crossroads react to their turmoil with two different extremes: some party and live life to the fullest because they know their luck will soon run out, while others desperately try to appease the beast by any means necessary.

Last Dance. Many of the locals of the Drowned Crossroads are celebrating the last party before the apocalypse. They will use jinxcraft to convince others to party with them. Any character who starts their turn within 15 feet of one of these locals must succeed on a [[/save CHA DC 19]] saving throw or have the &reference[charmed apply=false] condition for 24 hours. While Charmed in this way, the character parties without rest and gains 1 Exhaustion level at the end of that time. Characters who fail can repeat this saving throw every hour, and characters who succeed are immune for 24 hours.

Appeasing Meal. Many panicked swampfolk wish to calm the leviathan with sacrificial meals. Groups wander the swamps looking for victims. Every 8 hours spent in the Drowned Crossroads, the characters must succeed on a group [[/check STE DC 19]] check or be found and attacked by 20 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmBanditCaptain0]{Bandit Captains} seeking a new offering.

Swamp Things

The bayou has come to life with malevolent monsters that search for new meals for the Jinxed Leviathan, from hexed flora and fauna to the living dead and thralls risen from the unstable jinxcraft.

Bog Beasts. The swamp itself rises up at the command of the Jinxed Leviathan, including @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.iXXg49tXUKWxehi9]{Bayou Beasts}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.m4CCct4LzcFvgjaL]{Dream Eaters}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGiantCrocodile]{Giant Crocodiles}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGiantToad00000]{Giant Toads}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.ecqI3lBTgVoykPwV]{Gloomwoods}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.fuJHMByh1BJraTQi]{Gobblegeists}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmShamblingMound]{Shambling Mounds}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmSpiritNaga0000]{Spirit Nagas}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWaterElemental]{Water Elementals}, and whippoorwill flocks (use @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.CwhH1UpLfAWahAes]{Crowstorm}* stat block).

Jinxed Servants. Risen dead and bewitched thralls serve the beast, taking the form of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmBarbedDevil000]{Barbed Devils}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.tg7gMT759ls9CqOG]{Deepdrecks}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Rx2bHyP6K3q4taKX]{Ferrymen}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.HWnMB1dpNqJ23kCH]{Festerhulks}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmHornedDevil000]{Horned Devils}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.TPVllYMGvILDeOUR]{Kackles}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.AOoXC7NvOZy8bztM]{Lake Dredgers}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmTroll000000000]{Trolls}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmOgreZombie0000]{Ogre Zombies}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.aEPVMByT2COU30KF]{Wayward Haints}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.WqTPP2mqg3KIUiyr]{Wildpyres}*, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWillowisp00000]{Will-o’-Wisps}.

The Leviathan Smiles

Every night that goes by sees more folk succumb to the worsening misfortune, and the survivors increasingly resign themselves to hedonism as the raging revelry reaches a fever pitch. Only by baiting the swamp beast or finding its cursed bayou can the characters slay it and finally end the madness.

Bait the Beast. Although the Jinxed Leviathan will eat most living things, its favorite meal is a giant serpent sacred to the followers of Snake Eye Jack. One of these creatures can be found and used to bait the giant swamp monster into a trap with a successful group [[/check ANI DC 19]] or [[/check SUR DC 19]] check.

Accursed Murk. Although the story has been lost for generations, some survivors familiar with the folklore of the swamp tell the story of the cabal that sought to depose Snake Eye Jack. The location where the Jinxed Leviathan was first transformed can be learned with a successful group [[/check ITM DC 19]] or [[/check PER DC 19]] check.

The Monster of Misfortune

No matter how the characters approach the behemoth, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.7rdR1klh875p8ABz]{The Jinxed Leviathan}* erupts from the depths of the swamp, turning the black water of the bayou into raging waves. Glowing jinxcraft glyphs appear on every surface around it as its eternal hex spreads far and wide. Its jaws gnash and its tail thrashes in an effort to turn the characters into its finest meal yet.

Turn of Luck. When the Jinxed Leviathan is slain, it lets out a bellow and collapses into the murk. Immediately, the swamp grows dark and quiet as the powerful jinx that has cursed the Drowned Crossroads is broken and lifted. With the misfortune finally banished from the bayou, the people of Murkwater Bend and other settlements celebrate even more wildly than before, hoping to go out with a bang. The Crooked Moon turns its gaze southward to the Webwoods.

Level Up. The characters reach level 19, if they are still level 18, when they destroy the Jinxed Leviathan.

Fabled Heirloom. The @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.VFhZgDoZiRYempv0]{Tooth of the Jinxed Leviathan}* can be pulled from the maw of the slain beast.

The Dusk Mother.name: 黄昏之母 (The Dusk Mother)
The Dusk Mother.text:
The Dusk Mother

Once a human seamstress who practiced witchcraft, the mournful shade known only as the Dusk Mother was driven to inconsolable sorrow after she slew her children in a feverish ritual while possessed by a demonic entity she let into her home. In death, she has lingered in Wickermoor Hollow as a spirit clad in white, filled with immeasurable grief and hate. With the gaze of the Crooked Moon upon the Webwoods, a remote forest south of Wickermoor Village, her tether to the world of the living is at its strongest, and she seeks to ensure that all the valley shares in her misery.

The Threads that Bind

There is a ghostly witch in the Webwoods, and the humble farming communities near the forest’s edge are under her spell. The crops wither and die, the livestock turn up mutilated, the children disappear, and adults awaken with their eyes and mouths sewn shut—catatonic husks robbed of their souls. A teenage girl from a homestead, barely escaping the wrath of her parents after her siblings went missing, finds the characters and begs them to bring salvation to the forest’s edge.

The Webs They Weave

The Dusk Mother’s hut lies in the Webwoods, a forest normally overrun with enormous spiders but is now a network of webbing filled with haunted, spectral energies and agonized crying.

Tangled Webs. The Webwoods are choked with webs that seem to have a mind of their own. For every mile traveled through the wood, the characters must succeed on a [[/save DEX DC 20]] saving throw or have the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition (escape DC 18) and the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition for 8 hours. Additionally, each character who fails is immediately attacked by eight @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmEttercap000000]{Ettercaps}.

Ghostly Wails. Mournful wails of the Dusk Mother can be heard all around. For every hour spent within 5 miles of the tree line of the Webwoods, the characters must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 20]] saving throw or have the &reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition for 10 minutes as they break down into tears.

Come Little Children

The communities and homesteads near the Webwoods are nearly abandoned. The children have disappeared into the woods, and the adults that remain are bewitched and succumb to fits of convulsion and catatonic spells, barely responding to external stimuli.

Severed Soul. The eyes and mouths of the adults who remain are sewn shut. They have no souls, and their bodies seek new ones to inhabit them. Any character who cuts the threads and opens someone’s eyes and mouth must succeed on a [[/save CHA DC 20]] saving throw or have their soul trapped within the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{Commoner's} body as if by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicJar00]{Magic Jar} spell for 8 hours.

Babes in the Wood. Numerous children have been bewitched and lured into the woods by the Dusk Mother, crying and whimpering for their parents or siblings. When a character moves within 5 feet of a child, the child’s face turns wicked and they scream. Any character within 15 feet of the screaming child must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 20]] saving throw or have the &reference[charmed apply=false] condition from the Dusk Mother as if by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDominateMo]{Dominate Monster} spell for 1 hour.
