胜利Victory。 如果有一名玩家赢得了游戏，河口之王先是傲慢地笑着，然后询问玩家们的报酬是多少。如果他们诚实地回答阿德拉付给他们每人[[/award 150gp]]{150金币}（若承诺保密则为[[/award 200gp]]{200金币}），他会立刻表现出对价格的不满，但还是同意在他们提供讥笑罪人已死的证据后支付相应报酬。

如果他们试图谎报价格，就必须成功通过一次[[/check DEC DC 15]]检定来说服他。若报出的价格是每人[[/award 300gp]]{300金币}或更高，则此检定具有劣势。若检定成功，他同意支付他们所报的价格，但是最高不超过[[/award 300gp]]{300金币}。

失败Defeat。 如果河口之王或莱拉赢了，范德尔会微笑着摇头。他承认玩家们距离顶级赌徒还差点好运气，但他相信玩家们有胆量足以硬闯过去。毕竟，现在他们欠他一笔债——去杀了讥笑罪人才能还上。

是时候休息了Time to Rest。 游戏结束后，范德尔让玩家们在堡垒里休息，提供了一个足够多寝具可供所有人使用的小房间。在就寝之前，他邀请玩家们与他一起吃喝，这也让玩家们有机会进一步了解河口之王、沉沦岔路以及讥笑罪人。玩大话骰休整期和夜晚剩余的休息时间足够玩家们进行一次长休。

夜半尖叫

玩家们道了晚安并休息后，会被一阵在堡垒中回荡的刺耳的尖叫声惊醒。讥笑罪人的不死仆役已经潜入了浊水弯，攀上了堡垒的墙壁。当玩家们来到王座厅时，朗读或转述以下内容：

外面，尖叫声划破夜空，王座厅陷入一片混乱。河口之王的小弟们手忙脚乱地寻找武器，惊恐地望向门口。突然，门被撞开，一名浑身是血的哨兵踉跄着冲了进来，气喘吁吁地说：“他们来了……翻过墙了……”然后便瘫倒在地。

范德尔·布恩转向你们，声音低沉地咆哮：“搞快离开这！走北边的路，去罪人棚屋。一直跑，直到亲（听）到他在沼泽里弹那该死的弦乐。噔（登）上他的河船，砍死那条咧嘴笑的鳄鱼，结束这场噩梦！”

河口之王不会听任何抗议。如果玩家们想要进入村庄街道去战斗，甚至是违背他的意愿，你可以自行绘制街道地图，并安排四个由@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Rx2bHyP6K3q4taKX]{摆渡人}*带领的@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGhast000000000]{食尸鬼}来挑战他们。在战斗的第五轮和第十轮先攻20时，会有另一组类似的敌人出现。留下来战斗是愚蠢的，之后莱拉·韦伯也会加入战斗，鼓励他们去打败岔路先生，解救蛇眼杰克。

另一种情况下，玩家们会在小镇陷入混战时逃离。成群的不死者在街道上游荡，它们空洞的眼眶里只有杀戮的欲望。在一片混乱中，玩家们毫发无损地穿过杀戮现场，踏上了北边的道路。在这里，木制栈道逐渐变成了一条泥泞不堪、满是淤泥的小路，通向散发着恶臭的沼泽深处。

Liar's Dice Rules.name: 大话骰规则 (Liar's Dice Rules)
Liar's Dice Rules.text:
大话骰规则

大话骰的规则很简单，如果玩家们不熟悉，莱拉很乐意给他们解释。参与这场游戏的玩家有范德尔、莱拉和玩家们。

  • 每位玩家有五枚六面骰，每轮玩家需暗骰并查看自己的骰子结果（建议使用骰盅）。

  • 数字1被视为赖子，可当作任意数字。例如，一名玩家掷出两个4和两个1，实际上就可以当作有四个4。

  • 第一位参与者（第一轮从范德尔开始）要对所有参与者掷出的某点数的骰子的总数目进行叫注。比如，范德尔一开始可以安全地叫“两个2”。

  • 在每次叫注之后，左边的下一位玩家可以选择质疑该叫注，此时所有玩家需展示出自己的骰子。如果被挑战的玩家叫注宣传的某点数总数要大于实际骰出的某点数总数，那么在游戏剩余时间里他将失去一颗骰子。例如，若所有玩家中只有一个2（虽然可能性不大，但存在这种可能），那么范德尔在后续所有轮次中将永久失去一颗骰子。如果被挑战的玩家叫注合理（比如有两个或更多2），那么质疑者将永久失去一颗骰子。一旦质疑结束，玩家重新掷骰子，失去骰子的玩家在新一轮中最先进行叫注。

  • 如果左边的下一位玩家不想质疑，则必须提高叫注的数目（“三个2”）、点数（“两个3”），或者两者都提高（“四个4”）。除了点数最高为6之外，下一轮叫注时这两个数字的提升没有上限。

  • 这个叫注和挑战的过程按顺时针方向依次进行，游戏始终传递给左边的下一位玩家。

  • 当一名玩家失去全部五颗骰子时，他就被淘汰出局。

  • 游戏的获胜者是最后还剩有骰子的玩家。

你知道范德尔和莱拉的骰子情况。这没关系——他们知道如何在桌子底下交流以获取优势。

特殊规则Special Rules。 具备某些技能熟练项的玩家能够操控游戏局势，从而比玩家本人更像精明的赌徒。向玩家展示以下规则。

若你有下表中的某项技能或工具熟练项，便可在自己的回合中运用这些特性。在本场游戏里，你最多可将这些特性任意顺序组合去使用三次 ：

精准洞察（洞察）。 在你叫注或质疑之前，你可以指定一名参与者向你展示出他的骰子，且只能向你展示出。

灵巧手法（巧手）。 在你叫注或质疑之前，你可以将一颗自己的骰子变成任意数字。

隐秘漏牌（隐匿）。 在你叫注或质疑之前，你可以偷偷向一名参与者展示出你的骰子，他也可以选择是否也向你展示出他们的骰子。

扑克脸（欺骗）。 当参与者质疑你本回合的叫注时，你可以进行一次魅力（欺骗）检定，对抗DC 为15或另一名参与者的感知属性值（取两者中的较高值），若检定成功，则让参与者犹豫并不得不撤回质疑。

豪迈掷骰（赌具：骰子）。 在你掷完骰子后，你可以立即将任意数量的骰子变成你选择的点数。

命运眷顾（任意）。 在你叫注或质疑之前，你可以重新掷出所有剩余的骰子。

变体规则：快速大话骰

如果你不希望在游戏过程中玩一场整场大话骰游戏，你可以使用采用工具属性检定的方式来决定胜负。

依据赌具的规则详述，你可以要求有赌具：骰子熟练项的玩家进行一次[[/check WIS DC 20]]检定来确定游戏的获胜者。任何总值达到或超过20的赌徒输掉本局，如果有多名赌徒通过检定，则总值最高的赌徒获胜。

为了增加一些差异，掷骰时你可以允许玩家用魅力（欺瞒）检定做替代。如果玩家同时具备赌具：骰子和欺瞒的熟练项，则在此检定上获得优势。

To the Sinner's Shack.name: 前往罪者棚屋 (To the Sinner's Shack)
To the Sinner's Shack.text:
前往罪者棚屋

从浊水弯出发向北的道路蜿蜒着朝沼泽深处延伸，每过一英里，路面就变得更加泥泞，植被也愈发茂密。人们称它为蜿蜒沼径（Marshwinder Road），这是尽快穿越沉沦岔路而不借助船只的唯一途径。

在危机四伏的沼泽泥沼中穿行了六个小时后，路途中玩家们只能偶尔瞥见一些小屋、船库或钓鱼棚。他们终于听到了岔路先生的召唤。

这条蜿蜒潮湿的道路深入沼泽腹地。茂密的树冠遮蔽了月光，野兽的目光和低吼如影随形，不过可以确定的是，那些蹒跚的不死生物并未追来。沿着泥泞、杂草丛生的小路跋涉数小时后，你突然听到一阵低沉哀伤的弦乐声，悠悠地飘过左侧黑黢黢的水面。

你转过身，看到了这哀伤曲调的源头：一间破败不堪的单间木屋建在水上的木桩上，屋前的门廊垂下一架梯子。木屋的窗户透出炉火那温暖的光芒，一对对发光的瓶子漂浮在沼泽水面上，宛如引路的浮标，形成一条通往木屋的水上小径。

这里的水深4英尺，可以涉水而过，不过下面的淤泥很厚，每移动1英尺实际要用掉4英尺的移动距离。如果玩家们沿着作为导航信标的发光瓶子之间的路径前行，就能顺利抵达罪者棚屋。

如果有任何玩家离开了由这些瓶子标示的指定路径，无论是从水中走还是跨过瓶子，沼泽将会亮起厄咒的光芒并活化过来，@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.iXXg49tXUKWxehi9]{河口巨兽}* 会立刻发起攻击。

交易之间

顺着梯子爬到顶部，是一个简朴的门廊，俯瞰着下方那一汪黑水。一把摇摇欲坠的摇椅正轻轻晃动着，发出嘎吱嘎吱的响声，一把巨大的钢弦吉他放在摇椅座位上，随着每一次摇晃而前后摆动。窗户透出温暖橙色的光，然而透过玻璃，你只能看到模糊的影子。门没有上锁。当玩家们打开门时，朗读或转述以下内容：

门吱呀一声开了，那原本看似温馨的橙色灯光，竟是一场残酷的幻象。屋内，破旧的小屋里堆满了稀奇古怪的小玩意儿和零碎杂物。瓶子闪烁着诡异的新绿和洋红色光芒，这些光是从装饰在瓶身上的神秘符号中散发出来的。屋子后方，一条狭窄的木楼梯呈螺旋状向上延伸，消失在上方那隐于黑暗之中的未知区域。

岔路先生收藏的大量物品包括各式各样的厄咒奇珍*以及超自然药水*。此外，那些雕像以及形似各种生物的编织玩偶能够召唤出魔宠*。木屋里的每件物品都贴着一张破旧的纸质价格标签，上面都写着“3CP”。

当玩家们触碰其中一件物品、呼喊@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.xcfItWQMdjf5MK2k]{讥笑罪人}*，或者转身准备离开木屋时，岔路先生本人便会重重地踏着木地板从楼梯上走了下来。

沉重的脚步声从木屋后方的楼梯传来，紧接着是一阵低沉、咕哝的大笑声。“看呐、看呐……”楼梯上传来的声音说道，“来客果然不出我所料。”

一个身影走进了视野：那是一只身形宽大、体格健壮、但看起来毫无生气的鳄人，他穿着一件朴素的棕色外套，内搭一件红色马甲，左手唯余白骨。向上看去，他的头上戴着一顶饰有羽毛的高顶礼帽，咧嘴一笑，满口牙齿尽数显露。“我便是岔路先生。”他缓缓说道，“这里可有什么各位看得上的玩意？又或者，各位是来与我做一笔“交易”的？我们大可以礼貌地聊一聊，如何？毕竟正如你所见，我可是个绅士。”

与罪人交涉Parley with the Sinner。在这场对话中，讥笑罪人试图蛊惑并且与玩家们交朋友，免得他们搅黄有关阿德拉的计划。你可以阅读以下细则作为参考如何扮演岔路先生进行对话：

  • 他努力表现得迷人且毫无敌意，将任何威胁和侮辱当作玩笑话一笑置之。

  • 如果有人询问他那副类似不死者的模样，他会不以为然地将其归结为一种简单的皮肤病。他可不是不死生物——只是中了让自己逐渐衰弱的厄咒罢了。

  • 他邀请玩家们以客人的身份登上亡者之手号船，承诺会有吃不完的美食、喝不完的美酒以及无尽的赌博之夜。他甚至提出免费让他们玩几局游戏。

  • “罪者棚屋”是个快速达成交易以及售卖各种魔法小玩意的地方。他提供所有黑暗交易*，只需握个手就能达成交易。

  • 如果有人问起阿德拉，他会发誓说自己做了一笔公平的交易，只是她没仔细看合同细则。

  • 提到“幽灵之光快车”会使得岔路先生提起兴趣。若玩家成功进行一次[[/check INS DC 18]]检定，就会发觉岔路先生突如其来的好奇心十分可疑。

岔路先生坚持要求玩家们拿走一件物品或达成一笔交易，好把他们弄上自己的河船，并诅咒他们永远留在船上。

只能选一件Take One。 每个玩家只能选择一件物品或达成一项交易（黑暗交易、药水、奇物或魔宠）。若试图多买或敲诈更多物品，岔路先生都会拒绝。而且在拿走第一件小玩意之后，若再偷任何东西，一出小屋这些东西就会变成沼泽的污水。

达成交易Making a Deal。 如果每个玩家都接受了一项交易或购买了一件小玩意，岔路先生会向他们道别，并告知他们会在前方的亡者之手河船上见到他。他还说，在赌场里他们将是备受尊贵的客人（详见本章后面的亡者之手）。说完，他便在一阵洋红色火焰的爆发中消失不见。

拒绝罪人Refusing the Sinner。 如果讥笑罪人（岔路先生）的好意被断然拒绝，或者玩家们对他发起攻击，他会遗憾地摇摇头，接着咧嘴一笑，然后逃脱，并召唤出他的爪牙（见下文）。

沼泽追踪者

如果玩家们拒绝了岔路先生或者攻击了他，朗读或转述以下内容：

那个鳄人用它那只骨手掏出一块怀表看了看。“哎呀呀，瞧瞧这都什么时候啦！咱们没谈拢真是太可惜了，但现在我得回‘亡者之手’休息了。沿着河道一直走就到啦！”

他咔嗒一声掰响指骨，绚丽的品红色火焰骤然在他周身腾起，转瞬间便消失得无影无踪。片刻之后，木屋的门扉在木屑纷飞中轰然炸裂，一头由各种沼泽植物和厄咒符文纠缠而成的庞然巨兽踉跄地闯入室内。随着它的进入，整个房间顿时充斥着刺耳的嗡鸣声。

这个怪物是一只@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.iXXg49tXUKWxehi9]{河口巨兽}*，同时还伴随有六只大型且受厄咒的蚊子（使用@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmStirge00000000]{蚊蝠}的数据）。当这些怪物被击败后，它们会化为一摊烂泥。

小屋里的所有小玩意都还在，但如果一个玩家试图带走超过一件，除了他拿走的第一件小玩意外，其余的都会变成烂泥。任何没有达成黑暗交易或购买小玩意儿的玩家现在可以偷一件。如果他们这么做了，3CP（如果他们没带零钱，就拿走身上更大面额的硬币或宝石）会从该玩家的物品中消失，或者从离他们最近的人的物品中消失。然后这个玩家就能登上亡者之手河船了。

湖边

一旦每个玩家都获得了登上亡者之手的资格，就没有什么能阻挡他们找到河船并登上去。岔路先生所言非虚—令人惊讶的是—亡者之手河船此刻真的停泊在几英里以北的沼泽之路旁的湖里。当玩家们踏上这段旅程时，朗读或转述以下内容：

每走一步，这泥泞小路就愈发险恶，藤蔓与枝叶几乎将道路完全遮蔽。但就在你看见目的地之前，先听到了——远处飘来的爵士铜管乐在夜空中回荡，仿佛在迎接你的到来，将你引至这红树林环绕的湖畔。这片沼泽弯中央停泊着一艘巨大的河船，船身上下闪耀着鲜艳的霓虹光，摇曳出幽灵船般的诡魅形影。它那刻有厄咒的桨轮静止不动，但高耸的双烟囱却不时喷吐出品红色的火焰。

任何没有获得登上亡者之手资格的玩家的耳朵里听不到这音乐声，他们看到的只是一艘破败不堪、裂成两截的河船，露出漆黑水面的船体上还模糊地印着“欢笑LAUGH”字样。这样的玩家必须返回小屋拿一件小玩意儿才能登船。

一位友善的@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Rx2bHyP6K3q4taKX]{摆渡人}* 划着一艘刚好能容纳所有玩家的棺材船前来。它打扮成船夫的模样，眼窝里和额头中央各嵌着一枚铜币。它代表岔路先生向他们致意，并为他们提供前往亡者之手的航程。

命运塔罗牌解牌Fated Tarot Reading。 如果在第九章的“命运塔罗牌”环节抽到了“命运之轮”，那么在湖水下隐隐发光的@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.E9n5vyzSl49xQCXC]{布里格斯·库里奇的弯刀}* 将会被玩家们发现。

The Dead Man’s Hand.name: 亡者之手 (The Dead Man's Hand)
The Dead Man’s Hand.text:
亡者之手

这艘幽灵河船赌场徘徊于德拉斯肯瓦尔德与灵界(the land of spirits)的阴影交界处。在此处，蛇眼杰克的诅咒之力达到巅峰，而讥笑罪人从前的宗主仍被囚禁于此。

当玩家们探索时，他们可能会遇到这艘船最初的主人——现已成为不死生物的埃利亚斯·格里夫斯，并揭开亡者之手的秘密以及讥笑罪人针对阿德拉·德拉斯肯瓦尔德的阴谋。当进入船长室（区域 B8）时，河船会扭曲变为一个宏伟而华丽的舞台——这是与岔路先生最终对决的舞台。

Dead Man’s Hand Features.name: 亡者之手特性 (Dead Man's Hand Features)
Dead Man’s Hand Features.text:
亡者之手特性

除非另有描述，河船赌场内的房间具有以下特性：

照明Lighting。 外部房间有纸灯笼和刻在河船外部的发光厄咒符文散发着微光光照。内部房间则由水晶吊灯与镜面墙壁投射出提供明亮光照。所有这些灯光都散发着鲜艳的霓虹色彩，由讥笑罪人收集的燃烧的魂焰提供能量；玩家若在[[/check ARC DC 15]]或[[/check REL DC 15]]检定中取得成功，就会意识到这一点。

音乐Music。 欢快活泼的爵士乐在整个河船上回荡，通过魔法从在赌博大厅（见房间 B3）演奏的乐队处传来。无论人们的音乐品味如何，这音乐都出奇地动听。能听到音乐的生物在维持专注的豁免检定上有劣势。

厄咒符文Jinxcraft Sigils。 任何房间都能发现许多被刻在墙壁、地板和天花板上的发光厄咒符文，这些符文既用于囚禁蛇眼杰克的灵魂，也利用他的精魄为亡者之手供能。这使得整艘船充斥着它那给予运气的力量，吉运与厄运同时出现在人们身上。攻击检定在掷出19和20时都算作重击，并且在掷出1或2时都算重大失误。这一特性与勇士的“精通重击”等特性叠加（拥有“精通重击”的勇士在掷出 18、19 或 20 时算作暴击）。

赌徒们Gamblers。 来自威克摩尔山谷和德拉斯肯瓦尔德其他地方的数十人坐在赌场的赌桌旁，玩牌、掷骰，还有赌马——投注那些注法的赛马雕像，或者在各式酒水供应充足的酒吧里闲聊。他们都受到了诅咒——被赌场蛊惑人心的力量所奴役。他们初见面时表现得友好，会热情地带着玩家四处参观，并分享他们最喜欢的游戏，但他们对这艘船或其背后的阴谋知之甚少，还会引导玩家去询问那些亡灵赌场员工（他们似乎认为这些员工还活着）。任何干扰他们游戏的人都会让这些赌徒与之敌对。

豪赌之咒Curse of the High Roller。 当一名尚未被赌场诅咒的玩家在此完成一场赌博游戏后，必须进行一次[[/save WIS DC 8]]检定。若检定失败，则会被诅咒且陷入&reference[charmed apply=false]状态（来源为讥笑罪人）。处于此魅惑状态下的玩家会完全沉溺于享乐，一心只想继续赌博、饮酒、与顾客调情，或沉迷于当前所在的赌场区域活动。该玩家可每10分钟重复进行一次豁免检定，成功则解除效果。若连续两次豁免检定均失败，则玩家将彻底被俘获，不再进行后续豁免检定，并在诅咒持续期间对所有伤害赌场顾客或破坏河船欢乐氛围的D20掷骰都带有劣势。此诅咒将永久持续，直至以下情况之一发生才会解除：施放移除诅咒或其他类似魔法，讥笑罪人对玩家造成伤害，强迫玩家进行豁免检定或者死亡。

Dead Man's Hand Locations.name: 亡者之手区域 (Dead Man's Hand Locations)
Dead Man's Hand Locations.text:
亡者之手区域

以下区域位于地图 15.2 上。

B1: Dead Man’s Gangplank.name: B1：亡者之手的跳板 (Dead Man's Gangplank)
B1: Dead Man’s Gangplank.text:
B1: 亡者之手的跳板

当玩家们抵达亡者之手时，朗读或转述以下内容：

那艘阴森的河船停泊在湖中央，跳板降落在旁边一个小泥岛上。诡异鲜艳多彩的光芒从船的上层甲板倾泻而出，欢快的音乐飘荡在水面上，仿佛船内的派对永不停歇。两个身形魁梧的亡灵门卫在跳板顶部懒散地晃荡着。

这个跳板通向河船的上层甲板，两名身着门卫制服的@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmOgreZombie0000]{食人魔僵尸}正守在入口处，随时准备为宾客提拿行李并引导登船。

贵宾待遇Honored Guests。 若角色们是十字路先生邀请的贵客，门卫会以友善态度相迎，并引导他们前往赌博大厅（B3区域 ）等候。更多信息见该区域的“贵宾待遇”部分。

闯入者Intruders。 如果玩家们之前违抗了岔路先生，并通过偷窃或暴力手段获得了登船机会，这些守卫会表现得敌对，并一见面就发动攻击。不过，它们是头脑简单的莽夫，玩家可通过一次成功的[[/check DEC DC 16]]检定说服僵尸放行。

B2: Top Deck.name: B2：上层甲板 (Top Deck)
B2: Top Deck.text:
B2: 上层甲板

上层甲板环绕着整艘船。

河船的上层甲板上挤满了来自各地、衣着光鲜的德拉斯肯瓦尔德人，他们一边聊天，一边品尝香槟笛杯、威士忌平底杯和朗姆酒瓶中物，享受着不同于烟雾弥漫、拥挤不堪的赌博大厅的室外新鲜空气。这里距离赌博大厅的大门距离并不远。若不是你们想起讥笑罪人那令人不安的身影，这般欢快的交谈声和纸灯笼那奇异摇曳的光芒诱惑着你们加入他们的狂欢。

空乏的交谈Hollow Conversation。 与这里的赌徒们聊天是相当无聊、乏味的一件事，它们除了怂恿玩家们去喝酒赌博之外，没什么可分享的情报。然而，受到豪赌之咒影响的玩家（见前文“亡者之手特性”）会觉得这些交谈是他们听过的最深刻、最有吸引力的谈话。

受诅咒的赌徒The Cursed Gambler。 如果玩家们拥有@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.aMP7nYdF7PHVFKFo]{干枯手掌}*，其原主人能感知到它的存在并会寻找他们。在玩家们在上层甲板做了任何事情之后，比如与赌徒聊天、喝一杯酒或者调查任何异常情况，他们就会被@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Ixj3cZhC8CkUvP5Y]{埃利亚斯·格里夫斯}（使用@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGhoul000000000]{食尸鬼} 数据）注意到。他会蹒跚着走向他们。

一个瘦骨嶙峋、穿着不合身西装的服务员一瘸一拐地穿过甲板朝你们走来。当他走近时，一股恶臭弥漫开来，你注意到他本该是眼睛的位置只剩下空洞，皮肤成片剥落。这个人早已死去，但他的注意力却紧紧锁定在你们身上。他的左臂末端是一个残肢，他挥舞着残肢，似乎想要说话，下巴徒劳地抽动着，努力发出声音。

埃利亚斯所知What Elias Knows。 埃利亚斯无法说话。他的灵魂正在锅炉房（区域 B4）燃烧，为“他的船”提供动力。如果玩家们向他展示干枯手掌 ，这只手（里面有埃利亚斯灵魂的一片碎片）会有反应，并试图引导他们前往锅炉房。除非玩家们强行搬走它，否则埃利亚斯的身体不会跟随他们。

检查埃利亚斯Examining Elias。 如果玩家们卷起他左臂宽松的袖子，检查他的残肢，就会清楚地看到这只手曾经属于埃利亚斯——这令人不寒而栗，或许@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.aMP7nYdF7PHVFKFo]{干枯手掌}的持有者终将如此。

B3: Gambling Hall.name: B3：赌博大厅 (Gambling Hall)
B3: Gambling Hall.text:
B3: 赌博大厅

从上层甲板进入这个大厅，玩家们会来到一个俯瞰主舞厅的看台，他们可以通过一组楼梯下到大厅里面。客人们都是活着的但被诅咒的@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmCommoner000000]{平民}，而荷官和酒保则都是@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Rx2bHyP6K3q4taKX]{摆渡人}*。 房间角落有一个小舞台，五名@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmSkeleton000000]{骷髅}乐手组成了一个爵士乐队，用小号、长号、钢琴、单簧管和鼓演奏着欢快的音乐。

无数赌徒占据着这个空间，玩着各种能想象到的赌运游戏。任何时候，房间里都有 [[/r 1d12]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGhoul000000000]{食尸鬼}服务员和 [[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmOgreZombie0000]{食人魔僵尸}。如果玩家们未获邀请，它们一见面就会发动攻击；即便玩家们是获邀而来，但要是扰乱了氛围，比如骚扰客人或者打碎吊灯，它们也会发起攻击。一旦战斗爆发，客人们会尖叫着逃往上层甲板（区域 B2），而船员们则会战斗到死。

贵宾待遇Honored Guests。 在被讥笑罪人的守卫领进来后，玩家们会被要求在这里等候主人准备好接见他们，并且可以免费玩几局游戏。赌场会提供价值 100 金币的赌注、食物和饮料费用。食物十分美味；详见区域 B6。饮料则价格惊人，每杯 5 金币。如果玩家们在此等候半小时，且并非所有人都中了“豪赌之咒”，埃利亚斯就会找到他们（详见区域 B2“受厄咒的赌徒”）。要是玩家们无视他，三小时后，门卫会回来，将他们护送到船长室（区域 B8）。

参与游戏Joining a Game。 玩家们可以和被诅咒的赌徒玩牌或者掷骰子。为了模拟这些游戏，玩家们需下 1 到 20 金币的赌注，并使用合适的赌博工具进行一次 [[/check WIS DC 20]] 检定。成功则赢得双倍赌注，失败则输掉赌注。关于参与游戏的后果，无论输赢，详见前文“亡者之手特性”中的豪赌之咒。

B4: Boiler Room.name: B4：锅炉房 (Boiler Room)
B4: Boiler Room.text:
B4: 锅炉房

锅炉房内涌动着厄咒的不自然力量，其魂焰锅炉散发着幽灵般的洋红色光芒，映照在狭窄且阴影密布的走廊上。不死的工人们拖着脚步走来走去，修补破损的管道、搬运板条箱，维持着这座邪恶赌场运转所需的艰巨任务。埃利亚斯·格里夫斯饱受折磨的灵魂被困在锅炉之中。从讥笑罪人的控制中释放埃利亚斯，这能为玩家们带来强大的优势，同时能够切断束缚蛇眼杰克的燃魂咒缚（soul-fueled hexes），这也预示着岔路先生不可避免的覆灭。

然而，这种破坏行径会立刻让罪人察觉到玩家们的存在（详见下文“莫为格里夫斯哀伤”）。

魂焰锅炉Soulfire Boiler。 这个棺材形状、刻有符文的锅炉由一个名为魂焰炉工（@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWraith00000000]{邪灵}）的强大幽灵照料。她为讥笑罪人效力，通过吟诵厄咒，让埃利亚斯的灵魂不断再生，以维持洋红色魂焰的燃烧。如果玩家们进入锅炉房，她会要求他们离开，若玩家们留下或者反击，她就会发动攻击。当先攻开始时，锅炉会喷出 5 个@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmSpecter0000000]{幽灵}和一个@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rAQGFdLEjXhY6W0Y]{魂焰司炉}*，它们会加入战斗。

爆燃炉火Blasting Furnace。 当这里的战斗爆发时，锅炉内的火焰会熊熊燃烧，并通过炉门和装甲板缝隙喷涌而出。在先攻轮到 20（出现等值时视为后手）时，房间内的所有生物必须进行一次 [[/save DEX DC 13]] 检定，失败则受到 [[/damage 2d6 fire]]{7 (2d6)点火焰伤害}，成功则受到一半伤害。魂焰炉工、魂焰司炉和幽灵免疫此效果。

莫为格里夫斯哀伤Don’t Grieve for Greaves。 当最后一个灵体被击败时，朗读或转述以下内容：

炉火幽灵愤怒地哀号着，光芒一闪而灭，锅炉的洋红色火焰也随之熄灭。在这暗沉熔炉的钢制舱门后，唯余一团灰绿色的幽光悬浮其中。

这团灰绿色幽光就是埃利亚斯·格里夫斯的灵魂。当玩家们打开锅炉时，干枯手掌* 会试图顺着他们的身体爬上去，跳进锅炉并触碰幽光。一旦成功，它就会跑回埃利亚斯的身体，带着灵魂一起回去。一旦灵魂与身体重新结合，洋红色的光芒会重新回到格里夫斯的眼中，他也能再次开口说话。如果玩家与“手”建立了同调，这并不会解除同调状态。

他拖着疲惫之躯赶到船舱深处与众人相见，由衷感谢他们解放了自己的灵魂。他会回答玩家们关于他是谁、遭遇了什么、对岔路先生和蛇眼杰克了解多少，以及亡者之手是如何落入他手中的任何问题（详见本章前面的“沉沦岔路的非玩家角色”）。

因为“手“回到身体而使其灵魂复苏，他推断出了讥笑罪人与阿德拉·德拉斯肯瓦尔德交易的阴谋。他知道自己的灵魂之所以能为锅炉提供动力，是因为他在生前曾乘坐过幽灯特快列车。

随着他的灵魂即将被锅炉燃尽，他的利用价值也几近枯竭。岔路先生打算等阿德拉饱受枯萎诅咒后，将她的灵魂转移到锅炉里。如此强大的灵魂将为亡者之手和蛇眼杰克的囚牢永远提供动力。

埃利亚斯的遗赠Elias’s Gift。 埃利亚斯的灵魂已支离破碎、倦怠不堪，他渴望离去，以求最终的安息。临别之际，他为两名角色施放了@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.VtCXMdyM6mAdIJZb]{防死结界}。他对自己无法解除@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.aMP7nYdF7PHVFKFo]{干枯手掌}* 的诅咒深表歉意，但仍将一切托付给背负诅咒的玩家们，期盼他们能逃脱如他这般的命运。

他还将阿德拉·德拉斯肯瓦尔德的结婚戒指交给玩家们。这只手之前从岔路先生那里偷走了这枚戒指，并在前往玩家们所在处的途中藏在了埃利亚斯的口袋里以确保安全。他希望归还戒指能治愈阿德拉。最后道别之后，他眼中的光芒熄灭，身体倒下，终于得以安息。

警示岔路先生Alerting Mister Crossroads。 讥笑罪人能察觉到自己船上锅炉熄火的情况。他召集手下，10 分钟后冲进赌博大厅，准备与玩家们对峙。这会对区域 B3 造成以下变化：

  • 所有的赌徒和庄家都被赶出了大厅。他们要么聚集在上层甲板（区域 B2）的窗户周围，要么回到自己的住处（区域 B7）。

  • @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.xcfItWQMdjf5MK2k]{讥笑罪人}* 就在这里。有关他的行为表现，详见本章后面的“掷骰对决”。

  • 他有 6 个@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Rx2bHyP6K3q4taKX]{摆渡人}* 和 20 个@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGhoul000000000]{食尸鬼}作为后援。直接在赌博大厅与他展开战斗可不是个好主意。

  • 起初他不会诉诸武力，而是提议通过一场大话骰游戏来解决彼此之间的分歧（详见本章后面的“讥笑罪人的挑战”）。

B5: Coin Vault.name: B5：硬币金库 (Coin Vault)
B5: Coin Vault.text:
B5: 硬币金库

河船那宽敞如洞穴般的硬币金库，是一个潮湿的货舱，里面堆满了赌客们下注用的装满硬币的麻袋。墙壁上摇曳的霓虹灯笼发出微弱的光，照亮着这个房间。

铁笼Iron Cage。 这个房间的厚重木门上了锁（DC 15）。门后是一个铁笼，将整个房间笼罩其中，铁笼的金属栅栏间距仅 1 英尺。打开这个笼子的门需要解开一把坚固的锁（DC 20）。

金库守卫Vault Guardians。 这里无疑是河船上守卫最为森严的房间。金币守护者（@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWight000000000]{尸妖}）在 4 个浑身沾满沼泽污渍的@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGhast000000000]{食尸鬼}和 8 个@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGhoul000000000]{食尸鬼}的协助下守护着这一区域。

宝藏Treasure。 房间里有一袋金币（[[/award 500gp]]{500 金币}）、三袋银币（每袋含 [[/award 500sp]]{500 银币}）以及十二袋铜币（每袋含 [[/award 500cp]]{500 铜币}）。

B6: Galley.name: B6：厨房 (Galley)
B6: Galley.text:
B6: 厨房

河船的厨房由不死者厨师和服务员打理。尽管厨房工作人员都已死去，但这里出人意料地运营良好，他们端出的食物不仅卖相精美，而且味道鲜美。饮品也十分美味且强劲到足以缓解战斗带来的伤痛，饮用者可获得 [[/damage 2d4 temp]]{2d4 点临时生命值}。

B7: Crew and Guest Quarters.name: B7：船员与客舱 (Crew and Guest Quarters)
B7: Crew and Guest Quarters.text:
B7: 船员与客舱

船员舱曾是河船船员居住的地方，如今已空无一人。如今为讥笑罪人效力的不死生物无需睡眠。

相邻的客舱在任何时候差不多只有一半是住满的。在威克摩尔山谷的黑暗笼罩下，那些被贪婪和枯萎诅咒的客人们来来回回地穿梭于赌博大厅（区域 B3），只有在疲惫不堪时才会稍作休息。搜查这个房间不会发现任何有价值的东西。

B8: Captain’s Quarters.name: B8：船长室 (Captain's Quarters)
B8: Captain’s Quarters.text:
B8: 船长室

如果岔路先生没被引到别处，@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.xcfItWQMdjf5MK2k]{讥笑罪人}*就会在这里出现。他正坐在一张刻满厄咒符文的巨大书桌前，处理着生意上的各种细节。无论之前与岔路先生的初次会面是否以暴力收场（详见本章前面的“交易之间”），他都会像迎接朋友一样欢迎玩家们。即便玩家们之前侮辱并攻击过他，这位傲慢的咒术师也一心想着报复，但他自认为是个绅士，而非杀手。他会给出优渥的条件，只有在遭到反击时才会发动攻击。

当玩家们来到这里时，朗读或转述以下内容：

船长的舱室看起来不像一艘豪华河船里的房间，倒更像是一座航海博物馆。一面印着交叉腿骨和鳄鱼头骨的黑旗挂在岔路先生书桌后面的墙上，周围还挂着无数其他船员队伍破旧的旗帜。一个装在瓶子里的船模型放在书桌上。墙上自豪地挂着一支巨大的雷铳，上面刻着的符文闪烁着霓虹绿光和洋红色光芒。

如果岔路先生在这里，还需朗读或转述以下内容，并可根据玩家们迄今为止在船上的行动即兴添加一些额外评论：

那个毫无生气的鳄人坐在书桌前，他注意到了你们的到来。他站起身来，戴上羽毛礼帽，脸上挂着得意的笑容，清了清嗓子。

“欢迎各位莅临寒舍，但愿诸位已享受过敝处的博彩娱乐与美酒佳肴。”

讥笑罪人的挑战The Grinning Sinner’s Challenge。 为了化解彼此间的分歧，岔路先生给他们一个公平竞争的机会。在一场赢家通吃的大话骰游戏（详见本章前面的“运之试炼”）中与他一决高下。

他的赌注： 整艘船以及船上的所有人。要是输了，他就只能回去继续当个街头小骗子。他甚至还能解除阿德拉身上的枯萎诅咒。玩家们的赌注：他们在幽光快车上的经历让他们拥有了强大的灵魂，这些灵魂将在锅炉房里燃烧，直至化为灰烬。要是他们对此犹豫不决，他会再次提出贿赂。

接受挑战Accepting the Challenge。 如果玩家们接受挑战，他会露出满嘴獠牙的笑容，并召集手下前往赌博大厅（详见下文“掷骰子”）。

他的如意算盘？What’s His Angle? 进行一次成功的[[/check INS DC 20]]检定，玩家就能看出讥笑罪人并非信守承诺之人。他自私、傲慢，还是个输不起的人。

拒绝挑战！Rejected! 如果玩家们攻击讥笑罪人，或者在对方再三坚持的情况下仍拒绝他的提议，他会咆哮一声，然后在洋红色火焰的爆发中消失不见。接着，他会出现在赌博大厅（区域 B3），将这里变成一个闪烁着霓虹光芒的小型口袋维度，并准备战斗。不过，在此之前，他会再给他们最后一次通过掷骰子游戏解决分歧的机会（详见本章后面的“掷骰子”）。

Roll the Bones.name: 掷骰对决 (Roll the Bones)
Roll the Bones.text:
掷骰对决

岔路先生自视为一位高雅的绅士，极不情愿诉诸暴力。与岔路先生的这场遭遇分为两个阶段。第一部分是一场高赌注的大话骰游戏（见区域 B8）。若玩家们赢得这场游戏，他会失去冷静并发动攻击，但玩家们在战斗中会获得一项优势。若玩家落败，恐怕没人会甘心不战而交出灵魂。

当玩家们在船长室（区域 B8）接受他的挑战后进入赌博大厅（区域 B3）时，这场遭遇就会开始。如果他们在锅炉房（区域 B4）破坏了锅炉，惹得他大怒，也会引发这场遭遇。在这种情况下，他在此向他们发起挑战，但已完全做好了他们拒绝并开战的准备。

同舟共济

当玩家们满足上述条件进入赌博大厅（区域 B3）时，朗读或转述以下内容：

赌博大厅彻底变了样。赌桌重新进行了排列，中央赫然摆着一具四条腿的巨型棺材——表面雕刻着发光的符纹与多臂骸骨图案，骸骨的眼窝里嵌着骰子，每颗都显示一点。

整个空间诡异地膨胀，比原先更高更广。彩绘玻璃窗耸立在刻满狞笑骨蛇与诡谲符文的墙壁上，整个房间笼罩在闪烁的粉绿霓虹光芒中。赌徒们在看台和上层甲板上观看，而岔路先生则站在中央朝你们咧嘴一笑。他的数十个不死奴仆站在他身旁，他那被施了邪咒的雷铳斜挎在肩上。

他狞笑道：“都说圣徒不掷骰子，可咱们罪人就好这口。大话骰，赢家通吃。诸位既知赌注，请入局吧。”

赌博大厅已变成一个更巨大且扭曲的版本，闪烁着霓虹光芒，弥漫着蜿蜒的阴影。这张骰子桌不仅仅是一个游戏场所——它是蛇眼杰克的棺材牢笼，也是河船的力量源泉。如果锅炉被破坏，埃利亚斯·格里夫斯的灵魂被释放，符文会随时间逐渐褪色，棺材随着蛇眼杰克的苏醒而颤抖着，随时准备完成它的复仇。

任意数量的玩家都可以加入游戏，但至少得有一人参与。@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.xcfItWQMdjf5MK2k]{讥笑罪人}* 会根据每参加一名玩家，便在自己的骰池中额外增加一个 [[/r 1d6]]{D6}。

特殊规则

在对阵沼泽之王的大话骰游戏中适用的所有特殊规则（详见本章前面的“运之试炼”），在本场游戏里同样适用。游戏持续进行，直到只剩一名玩家，即获胜者。不过，要是岔路先生被淘汰，他会怒吼着掀翻桌子，不承认这局游戏。

讥笑罪人的策略

岔路先生喜欢下重注。他开局便会以自己最多同点数骰子的数量+1下注（例如，如果他有三个 4 点，就会下注四个 4 点）。而且，他起手时的骰子数量就比玩家们多，这让他能激进地出价。

转动命运之轮

游戏只会在当所有玩家都输掉游戏，岔路先生掏出雷铳夺走他们的灵魂投入锅炉；或者当岔路先生被淘汰，掀翻桌子发动攻击时结束（详见下文“河口热舞”）

Bayou Boogie.name: 河口热舞 (Bayou Boogie)
Bayou Boogie.text:
河口热舞

无论玩家们是赢是输，哪怕他们接受了交易，@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.xcfItWQMdjf5MK2k]{讥笑罪人}* 也无意让他们活着离开亡者之手。在将赌博大厅扭曲成一个厄咒赌场，并释放出蛇眼杰克以及沼泽本身的力量，誓要摧毁他们，这样他就能将他们的灵魂投入魂焰锅炉。这场两阶段战斗的两个阶段，都使用地图 15.3。

厄咒赌场的特性

除了亡者之手的特性外，扭曲后的赌博大厅还有以下特性：

二层看台Balcony。 一个宽大的楼梯通向位于游戏区上方 20 英尺处的二层看台，看台环绕着整个房间。

厄咒维度Jinxcraft Dimension。 这个房间是利用蛇眼杰克的力量创造出的一个独立半位面。任何穿过破碎窗户的物体，会从对面墙壁的窗户重新出现。

膨胀空间Larger Than Life。 在这个半位面里，赌博大厅异常的膨胀变大。现在此处长90尺、宽60尺，天花板高60尺，这让岔路先生有足够的空间飞到难以触及的地方。

沼泽漫溢Swamp Water。 沼泽淹没了游戏区，水深达 2 英尺，这使得这里成为困难地形。

蛇眼劫数Rolling Snake Eyes

如果一个或多个玩家在大话骰游戏中击败了岔路先生，蛇眼杰克——鳄人从前的宗主——开始挣脱束缚，向长久以来欺骗他的施术者释放他的厄咒之怒。他会赐予玩家们一个好运加持。

掷两个 [[/r 1d20]]{d20} 并记录下每个数字。在战斗中，当某个生物进行 D20 检定时，玩家可以选择使用其中一个记录下来的数字。该生物将此数字当作在D20上掷出的结果。每个数字只能使用一次。当讥笑罪人或玩家们被击败时，这个好运加持就会消失。

蛇眼杰克的影响

在先攻20（先攻相同时后置）时，蛇眼杰克被迫引发以下一种效果；杰克不能连续两轮使用相同选项：

摆渡人Ferrymen。 如果战斗中没有@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Rx2bHyP6K3q4taKX]{摆渡人}*，出现三个来协助讥笑罪人。这些不死爪牙的生命值只有 10 点。

霉运缠身Rotten Luck。 在下次先攻20 之前，蛇眼杰克的棺材 30 英尺半径范围内的一个生物会被厄咒。当被厄咒的生物进行攻击检定时，必须从结果中减去 [[/r -1d4]]。

骸骨之握Shackling Grasp。 阴影凝聚的骸骨手臂从蛇眼杰克的棺材中猛然伸出。力量豁免检定：[[/save STR DC 15]]，距离棺材 30 英尺范围内最多三个生物。失败：目标陷入被擒抱状态（逃脱 DC 15），直到杰克再次使用此选项。若目标豁免失败，可选择承受 3（1d6）点黯蚀伤害来代替失败。

Phase 1: All In.name: 第一阶段：孤注一掷 (Phase 1: All In)
Phase 1: All In.text:
第一阶段：孤注一掷

无论玩家在骰子游戏中是赢是输，还是他们完全拒绝了岔路先生的提议，朗读或转述以下内容：

讥笑罪人盯着你们，用他那骷髅左手拔出他的厄咒雷铳。“当我如此下注，便意味着岔路先生绝无败北的可能。你们的灵魂是我的了。”

他将雷铳举向天空，爵士乐变得阴森且刺耳。房间开始震颤，高大的船窗纷纷破碎。沼泽从四面八方涌入，开始淹没赌博大厅，蔓生的沼泽植物爬进来，在墙面上蜿蜒蔓延。

亡者之手的船员们痛苦地哀号着，跪倒在地。它们的生命力被抽离出来，很快化作了枯槁的干尸。那些能力化作巨大的漩涡涌入那把雷铳。他癫狂地大笑，显露出狰狞的笑容。“来碰碰运气吧，我的朋友们！”

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.xcfItWQMdjf5MK2k]{讥笑罪人}* 将对玩家发动攻击并且死战到底。他把原本是骰子桌和蛇眼杰克囚笼的棺材召至身边，然后踏棺而行（详见他的棺材骑手Coffin Rider特性）。

Phase 2: Double Down.name: 第二阶段：加倍下注 (Phase 2: Double Down)
Phase 2: Double Down.text:
第二阶段：加倍下注

当@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.xcfItWQMdjf5MK2k]{讥笑罪人}* 浴血时，他的绝望会压倒理智。

岔路先生的眼中绝望肆虐，他暴怒地嘶吼着，不断地跺着他脚下的棺材。“给老子动起来，杰克！我知道你这混账还没出全力！”

刹时间，棺材上的符文光芒更盛！你们突然感到周遭的“运气”正在被某种力量粗暴地扭曲。无数阴影凝聚的毒蛇与枯手从棺盖缝隙中钻出，如同活物般蜿蜒蠕动。

他深深汲取着蛇眼杰克的力量，周身闪烁着洋红色和绿色的能量。他在攻击检定上获得优势，但针对他的攻击检定也同样获得优势。

蛇眼杰克继续像第一阶段那样施加影响，不过此时，从棺盖下渗出一些模糊像是骷髅手或蛇的阴影丝缕，它们朝着讥笑罪人伸去，随后消散。

击败讥笑罪人

当@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.xcfItWQMdjf5MK2k]{讥笑罪人}* 的生命值降至0点时，束缚杰克的最后一道厄咒束缚也随之瓦解，蛇眼杰克夺走了他的灵魂。

岔路先生绝望地咆哮着，坠入下方的水域中。霎那间，一个洋红色的鳄人虚影从他倒下的身躯中升起，眼中满是恐惧。受厄咒束缚的棺材轰然爆开，伴随着一阵低沉笑声，十几条骨手与影蛇从中伸出，牢牢地摄住罪人的灵魂，将其拖入棺材内那莫测的深渊之中。随着棺盖砰地关上，棺材上面已然刻着鳄鱼头骨与交叉腿骨的图案。

空气中弥漫着朗姆酒和硝烟的气味，你们的视线变得模糊的同时，你们发现自己回到了真正的亡者之手赌博大厅。灯光已经熄灭，赌场那狂乱的能量也消失不见。岔路先生的尸体瘫倒在房间中央，雷铳仍然紧紧握在他冰冷的手中，他那毫无生气、死不瞑目的双眼凝固着它死前的惊恐。

随着岔路先生的死亡，他的不死奴仆们齐声发出叹息，随后化为尘埃，这个半位面也随之崩塌，将其中的所有东西都送回了真正的亡者之手。数十个脱离了癫狂的困惑的赌徒正四处寻找离开河船的路。

升级Level Up。 如果玩家们此前处于 6 级，在击败讥笑罪人后，他们将升至 7 级。

命运塔罗牌解牌Fated Tarot Reading。 如果在第九章的“命运塔罗牌占卜”环节抽到了“皇帝”，那么可以从岔路先生冰冷的手中抽出@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.sZvX99kRvdvtZt1C]{讥笑罪人的雷铳}*。这支枪仍被厄咒加持，功能完好无损。

Conclusion: Out of the Haze.name: 结局：迷雾渐散 (Conclusion: Out of the Haze)
Conclusion: Out of the Haze.text:
结局：迷雾渐散

通往浊水弯的道路如今已安全无虞。骗子鳄鱼和他的被诅咒的船员们消失得无影无踪，就连沼泽里的生物也恢复了往日，相对不那么邪恶的习性。赌徒们陪着玩家们回到镇上，随后便各自散去，踏上归乡之路——或许在德拉斯肯瓦尔德的某处。

沼泽之王和莱拉侥幸存活了下来，尽管他们的手下为了保护他们和镇子遭受了重大损失。范德尔神情肃穆，若有所思，开始思索统治者这个职责的真正分量。莱拉相信，有朝一日他会成为一位出色的王——而且统治的对象可不只是那些无赖之徒。她提醒范德尔，如果他欠了玩家们的钱，一定要还上，还敦促他们去向派遣他们前来的人领取报酬。

回到威克摩尔村

随着岔路先生的死亡，阿德拉·德拉斯肯瓦尔德枯萎的手臂痊愈了。如果玩家们归还她的结婚戒指，她会心怀感激地收下，并支付你们所约好的报酬——成功骗过了菲利普，暂时让这对焦虑的夫妇重获平静的生活。要是玩家们自己保存戒指，它价值 [[/award 1000gp]]{1000 金币}。然而，阿德拉的这次遭遇让旧途结社的信徒们愈发大胆起来。他们开始蛊惑她的亲信加斯顿·杜雷（Gaston Doray），试图拉拢他加入自己的阵营。而这种显而易见的弱点也吸引了害兽集会（Vermintoll Coven）的注意，该会活着的成员斯托诺加（Stonoga）和戈卢布(Golub)加倍努力，妄图腐蚀村里的人。

一些获救后无家可归的赌徒在威克摩尔村定居下来，他们把赌博游戏带到了绿荫女王酒馆，当地人也很快参与其中。光明歌者宣扬节制之道，还派遣传教士前往沉沦岔路。

Chapter 26: Moonfall.name: 第26章 - 月陨
Chapter 26: Moonfall.text:
Chapter 26:

Moonfall

“The moon knows you, stranger. It has been waiting since the first stone was laid, since the first bone was buried. She comes to claim what was promised. And if you meet her mad gaze, it’s too late-they’ve already chosen you.”

- Rowan -

The horrors the characters have overcome were merely a prelude to the nightmare that now looms over Wickermoor Hollow. Though Kehlenn’s influence has been severed from the land, her imprisonment within the Crooked Moon above did not put an end to her primeval power. The defeated archfey seeks her final revenge: the total destruction of the realm she once ruled. Her leering gaze settles on Wickermoor Hollow for the last time, awakening eight ancient beings of immense power to bring the moon crashing down upon Druskenvald, destroying everyone and everything within.

With Kehlenn’s defeat at the Crooked Tree, a fragile peace has settled over Wickermoor Hollow, but it is a peace born of fear and uncertainty. Even in the face of victory, the people of the valley have been forever changed by the horrors that have occurred over the past weeks and months. While many inhabitants of the valley may not know the events that occurred in the Wytchwood and how close the Horned King came to annihilating them, they all soon learn of the new doom descending from above.

The moon’s grin has curled into a sneer as it wakes eight eons-old powers still tethered to the land. With the promise of a transformation of the domain into their own image, these mythic beings call the moon down from the night sky to eventually crash into Wickermoor Hollow. The resulting cataclysm would destroy the whole of Druskenvald and remake it as Kehlenn and her champions see fit. The characters must act quickly, or all they have fought to save will be lost with the moon’s apocalyptic embrace.

Endgame

This optional chapter offers guidance for leading 13th level characters to the pinnacle of 20th level, providing the inspiration to craft challenging and harrowing encounters that will test their might and resolve. This chapter is aimed at tables that favor epic tiers of play and want to experience grandiose stakes of high fantasy.

If you wish to continue the campaign after the main events of The Crooked Moon, this chapter presents a flexible framework that challenges players while maintaining the unsettling dread central to folk horror. If you plan on following this path, the characters should not reach 14th level after defeating the Horned King. Instead, each character increases one ability score of their choice by 2. This increase can’t raise a score above 24.

  • Characters who seek to prevent Kehlenn’s final vengeance have the following goals:

  • Seek out each of the eight awakened powers of Wickermoor Hollow.

  • Destroy them and sever their tether to the Crooked Moon.

  • Banish Kehlenn to the Crooked Moon for all time.

Many of the specifics of how the characters embark on this final adventure will be up to you to decide. If the adventure incorporated Fateweaving (see chapter 9), you must decide how the various climaxes and catharses of the characters would affect the events presented in this chapter.

The Moon is Falling.name: 月陨 (The Moon is Falling)
The Moon is Falling.text:
The Moon is Falling

One terrible night, the Crooked Moon lets out a horrific shriek and speaks with Kehlenn’s voice, delivering a message that echoes across Wickermoor Hollow: the moon shall fall, and doom will come in thirteen nights. Slowly but surely, the moon begins to grow larger in the sky as it descends toward the valley.

The inhabitants of Wickermoor Hollow react in a variety of ways—some turn to panic, others to prayer, and surprisingly, many resign themselves to the end. However, most are too preoccupied with the destructive effects of the eight evils that have risen and the horrors they’ve unleashed upon the land. This development will stress or empower the relationships that the characters have nurtured during their time in Wickermoor Hollow.

Impending Doom

The characters must now hunt down these emerging evils, racing against time as each victory delays the moon’s fall—but not its inevitable approach. Further, every moment wasted allows the once-dormant threats to grow in power and cause mass destruction ahead of the impending apocalypse.

Countdown to Extinction

As soon as the Crooked Moon begins falling, it will crash into Wickermoor Hollow in exactly thirteen nights. If this occurs, the resulting collision and explosion of primordial energy annihilates the entirety of Druskenvald, including the characters if they are still within the realm when the moon makes impact. This ends the campaign.

Achieving Victory. The only way to prevent Druskenvald’s downfall is to kill all eight of the ancient evils bound to Wickermoor Hollow and reject Kehlenn’s final bargain. This returns the Crooked Moon to its rightful place in the sky and ensures that the Crooked Queen is powerless forever.

Tracking Time. As each of the thirteen nights progresses, keep track of how many nights are left before the inevitable collision. Clearly describe to the players that the moon is growing larger in the sky and its face is growing more menacing. Also, consider how the people of the valley act in the face of a seemingly inevitable death.

Delaying the Inevitable. Each time one of the ancient evils is slain, the descent of the moon stops for 24 hours. This means that if the characters continually kill the powerful enemies before them, they have a full twenty nights to stop the doom.

Turn Back Time. If you wish to give the characters additional time or believe they have earned help, the Vagrant arrives right before the collision and aids them. He plays a powerful song on his fiddle that turns back time 72 hours, buying the characters three additional nights. Due to the timeless nature of the ancient evils, any of them killed before or during this reverted time remain dead.

The Old Fears

Eight fearsome beings bound to the land of Wickermoor Hollow stir and rise to power, having felt the gaze of the Crooked Moon upon them. Imbued with Kehlenn’s primordial energies, they have exchanged their own ties to Wickermoor Hollow so that the moon can continue to plummet toward a cataclysm with the promise to remake the realm in their own image. They are as follows:

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.jsMSxEGRbXiyBrvJ]{The Galloping Headsman}. A headless phantom of fiery wrath driven by revenge.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.6rBNaLaLnzUxIFnE]{The White Worm}. An eldritch being from beyond the stars that feasts on memories.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.IPd6YjfKVIKjyL9O]{The Tall Man}. A twisted and corrupted archfey that stalks the woods for victims.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.9v5OzJNAF4k0phid]{The Wild Titan}. A gigantic manifestation of the wilds that seeks to unleash savagery.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.6bKvmUDO3OwfCtDN]{The Barrow King}. A long-dead king seeking glory who commands Undead legions.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.31QEGa6vRpH7cm8l]{The Jinxed Leviathan}. An enormous swamp beast imbued with the essence of bad luck.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.UxdQKpuXZDrkjuys]{The Dusk Mother}. A tormented spirit of loss that spreads her misery to all.

@UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Xx2E0pzymhXavH3H]{The Brimstone Behemoth}. A volcanic colossus of hellfire that ushers in armageddon.

The characters must defeat these legendary creatures in order, each one more powerful than the last, if they hope to save Druskenvald. The subsequent sections of this chapter feature the eight ancient evils, including the following tools to craft an exhilarating adventure for each:

  • A quest hook that points the characters in the direction of the ancient evil.

  • The effects of the legendary creature’s presence on the land, which are in addition to its lair features (see appendix A).

  • How the locals are tormented, affected, and corrupted by it.

  • What types of monsters and minions that might serve it.

  • The circumstances of the final showdown with the powerful being.

  • How the afflicted people react to the destruction of the creature.

The Galloping Headsman.name: 疾驰刽子手 (The Galloping Headsman)
The Galloping Headsman.text:
The Galloping Headsman

Centuries ago, a centaur served as an executioner to the people who first founded Foxwillow. Due to corruption at the highest levels of the town’s leadership, this headsman was falsely accused of murder, dragged through an unjust trial, and beheaded before the whole town. While its townsfolk exclaimed justice, the blood that spilled on the soil bound the centaur’s spirit to the fields. With the power of the Crooked Moon, the Galloping Headsman thunders through the farmland, seeking justice against his killers’ descendants, whipping them up in a frenzy of paranoia that spelled his doom so many years ago.

Hysteria in Foxwillow

The distrust sown by the secrets revealed during the Harvest Terror’s attack has boiled into all-out conflict, plunging the farming community into mass hysteria. A farmer from the town seeks out the characters and tells them that neighbor has turned against neighbor, and folks are being condemned to death by beheading. The executioner is rumored to be a spirit of fiery wrath that rides to meet each of the condemned, lops off their heads, and adds them to its collection.

Fields of Vengeance

The fertile farmland around Foxwillow—so easily corrupted by the demonic influence of Raum—craves vengeance and has come to life under the ghastly influence of the Galloping Headsman.

Stone Pressing. The earth itself opens up, attempting to swallow the accused and crush them with the stones within. For every mile traveled, characters must succeed on a [[/save STR DC 17]] saving throw or fall into a sinkhole and be &reference[restrained apply=false]. While restrained in this way, a character takes [[/damage 1d8 bludgeoning]]{4 (1d8)} bludgeoning damage at the start of each of their turns. A restrained character repeats the save at the end of each of their turns, freeing themself on a success.

Choking Crops. The crops attempt to choke the life out of the wicked. The first time a character enters any field that bears crops, its roots, stalks, or vines attempt to strangle the character. They must succeed on a [[/save STR DC 17]] saving throw or be &reference[grappled apply=false] for 1 minute (escape DC 15). While grappled in this way, the character gains 1 level of &reference[exhaustion apply=false] at the end of each of their turns. A character that can't be charmed succeeds automatically. The crops have AC 5; 10 hit points; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning and psychic damage.

Mob Injustice

When the characters arrive at the Foxwillow Farmland, they find its people are hostile to them, accusing them of witchcraft, murder, sabotage, and of causing the incoming apocalypse. Some cunning townsfolk even attempt to act as friends to earn their trust before turning them over to frenzied mobs.

Vengeful Wrath. The wrathful emotion of the Galloping Headsman spreads like a virulent plague. Whenever a character comes within 20 feet of a Foxwillow villager, the character must succeed on a [[/save CHA DC 17]] saving throw or lose the ability to distinguish friend from foe, regarding all creatures it can see as enemies. On a success, the character is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

Wandering Mob. Roving gangs of vigilantes hunt the characters in the hopes of capturing, imprisoning, trying, and executing them. Every 1 hour that the characters spend within 1 mile of the town center of Foxwillow, they must succeed on a group DC 17 Dexterity (Stealth) check or be detected and attacked by 20 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.Cy3A0rsNMPLZozam]{Thugs}.

All Hallows’ Evil

The emergence of the Galloping Headsman has twisted the Foxwillow farmland’s flora, fauna, and people, and it has awakened monstrous creatures with a burning vengeance:

Vengeful Spirits. The Headsman has riled up the spirits of the dead that faced wrongful deaths and seek retribution. These take the form of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.5kZNNWzZ6HrfKuWf]{Centaurs} (Undead), @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.dIyqjDIqRxD56Njq]{Kackles}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.n6v8HLbHbKBRjVAH]{Phantom Hearses}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Jj23zmBla6ZrN6po]{Pumpkin Heads}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{Wayward Haints}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.8KSVpQZyzius93ko]{Will-o-Wisps}, and Wraiths.

Monsters of the Fields. Livestock and scavenger birds have been twisted by the Headsman’s vengeful fury. These take the form of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.EpYl7qifM5pq6W6B]{Cockatrices}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.IY9xoFINnJsrOXll]{Corvodaemons}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.1zXL5U1wR5aMwloG]{Crowstorms}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.DmufsvYsb3sUkAp9]{Drakkenhobs}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.dYtBDxMs6HfcJO8E]{Gobblegeists}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.nZthq6WHLhcdu3te]{Gorgons}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.pOPQU4UnR27zA0jf]{Minotaurs}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.5SgVGhQBswgWRwsF]{Nightmares}.

Vengeance’s Reckoning

Some townsfolk whisper of a shadowy figure that looks like a rider on horseback but joined as one. They revere this being as an angel of judgment, punishing their town for the wickedness of their neighbors. The characters must learn where they can find this spirit to put an end to the mass hysteria.

Tarnished History. The characters can investigate Foxwillow to learn about the village’s dark past. If the characters succeed on a group [[/check HIS DC 17]] or [[/check INV DC 17]] check, they learn the headsman’s story and that he was beheaded before the covered bridge to the east of town toward the edge of Wickermoor Hollow.

Bloody Trail. The characters can tail a mob as it dispenses its “justice” or even infiltrate its ranks with a successful group [[/check STE DC 17]] or [[/check DEC DC 17]] check to witness the attempted execution of a falsely accused villager.

The Headless Horseman

Characters who arrive at the covered bridge can lure out the vengeful spirit with the offering of the execution of a Foxwillow local or by inciting its warped sense of justice. @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.jsMSxEGRbXiyBrvJ]{The Galloping Headsman}* rides out from the darkness of the bridge’s cover and charges the characters, seeking to behead them all and slake its never-ending thirst for vengeance.

Reckoning’s End. With the Galloping Headsman’s destruction, the town is freed from his oppressive judgment. The people of Foxwillow gain clarity and realize that they must aid their neighbors in these final nights. Grateful to the characters, they decide to spend their final hours feasting and celebrating instead of falling to despair. The Crooked Moon shifts, its gaze turning toward Moonsong Lake.

Level Up. The characters reach 14th level, if they are still 13th level, when they destroy the Galloping Headsman.

Fabled Heirloom. The @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.KF2NetHlZQnSuPWf]{Axe of the Galloping Headsman}* is left behind after the vengeful spirit is destroyed.

The White Worm.name: 白虫 (The White Worm)
The White Worm.text:
The White Worm

A once unfathomable horror from a forgotten reality beyond the stars, the eldritch entity known as the White Worm was pulled through the veil by the rituals of Matron Lethica (see chapter 17). Imprisoned for many years beneath Memory’s Rest Sanatorium, it feasted upon the memories of the hospital’s patients before escaping into the depths of Moonsong Lake. After recovering from its long torment and being fed countless ancient memories by the Crooked Moon, it has undergone a metamorphosis into its true form as a cosmic horror. It now ravenously hungers for the memories of Druskenvald until the land itself is forgotten.

A Feast for Worms

Moonsong Lake is infested with worms. These parasites slither through the water supply and infect the people who live upon its shores. Memories are devoured, personalities are reshaped, and bodies are contorted into horrific abominations of alien biology. A member of a small fishing village approaches the characters and begs them to end the infestation and restore the identities of the mindless victims.

Lake of the White Worm

The waters of Moonsong Lake and its estuary are tainted with alien parasites that sap memories, feeding them to the White Worm and spawning more thralls for the hivemind.

Water of Forgetfulness. Any character who drinks from the water of Moonsong Lake, or any well, river, or stream within 5 miles of it, must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 17]] saving throw or be & reference[poisoned apply=false] for 8 hours. While poisoned in this way, the character loses all memories from before the moment they drank the water. A character who succeeds on this save is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

Parasite Found. Any character immersed in the water of Moonsong Lake must succeed on a [[/save CON DC 17]] saving throw or be infected with a spawn of the White Worm. Unless the character receives a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{Lesser Restoration} spell or similar magic, they transform into a @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.aHAfPdP24eevOUSO]{Wormhost Surgeon}* in 7 days.

A Strange Folk

When the characters arrive on the shores of Moonsong Lake, they find the fishing villages filled with folk who are oddly at peace with the coming doom. Some sit catatonically with no recollection of who they are or who they once were. Those who have not forgotten their memories are secretly hostile to the characters and seek to turn them into thralls of the White Worm.

Cult of the Worm. White Worm cultists cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.91Sw6vOIaO7U8DvM]{Dominate Person} (DC 17) on any character who is alone with them.

Shattered Psyche. The minds of those who have forgotten themselves are filled with oblivion. Any character who uses magic to attempt to read a villager’s thoughts or look into their mind must succeed on a [[/save INT DC 17]] saving throw or be affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.hYCrN82dMJFuJODB]{Feeblemind} spell.

Things From Beyond

The reawakening of the White Worm has twisted the minds of the lake’s denizens to her alien will, and a tear to its home reality has opened at the bottom of the lake, unleashing unspeakable things into the dark water.

Deep Dwellers. The creatures that lurk in the depths of Moonsong Lake and are influenced by the great memory devourer include @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.AOJvmk1IchxNxQzP]{Giant Crabs}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.Ixo5shumxy4I9qyD]{Giant Toads}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.p9Xnr820UAZBOIVN]{Giant Octopi}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.K4vsSlHqbBAHUDHY]{Hydras}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.vZTvzdrNT55h7MSl]{Lake Dredgers}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.4OeZZguYgJcsZoM9]{Plesiosauruses}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.KXG5XLIwKhn1V0Y5]{Swarms of Quippers}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.is1flJzkyN5O8cco]{Wellwyrms}*, and worm swarms (use the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.XfQMBoTh892XSnCX]{Swarm of Poisonous Snakes} stat block).

Alien Invaders. Entities from beyond the stars drift through the veil into Druskenvald. These take the form of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.shhHtE7b92PefCWB]{Aboleths}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.P6qC8jB3pnEH0tIE]{Chuul}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.HPUO3weiwRQnql0d]{Cloakers}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.8pX2JhWUpTNNRBVx]{Gibbering Mouthers}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.zDY4ljG6kZybcFMW]{Invaders Out of Space}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.wYDQmBRsrRo8AAta]{Mutant Nurses}*, and @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.aHAfPdP24eevOUSO]{Wormhost Surgeons}*.

The Hunger Below

The people of the lakeside babble and sometimes shriek of the “thing in the lake” and its unending hunger that seeks to consume all memory of Druskenvald. Rumors of ancient ruins built by the original denizens of the lake hold the key to the creature’s origin and goal. The characters must find the tear in reality at the bottom of the lake to restore memory to the people.

Black Obelisks. The characters can search for ancient ruins of the original lake dwellers. After locating the ruins, they can study the carvings. With a successful [[/check ARC DC 17]] or [[/check INV DC 17]] check, the characters learn of the White Worm's origin and the signs to find it.

Into the Cult. The characters can feign interest in willfully joining the esoteric order that worships the White Worm with a successful group [[/check DEC DC 17]] or [[/check PER DC 17]], learning its secrets.

The Eldritch Horror

Characters who find a way to brave the water and survive its crushing depths find reality and their minds warp the deeper they delve. Once they discover the tear into the long-forgotten reality, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.6rBNaLaLnzUxIFnE]{The White Worm}* emerges into the black water and attempts to devour the characters in both body and mind.

Remembering Once More. With the destruction of the White Worm, its tether to Druskenvald is broken, and its essence is ripped into the tear in reality as the rift seals forever. The parasitic worms wither and die, and the water becomes clean once more. The people around the lake regain their memories, though many wish they hadn’t, for now they are gripped with the terror of their inevitable doom. The Crooked Moon, ever closer, looks to Hartsblight Forest.

Level Up. The characters reach 15th level, if they are still 14th level, when they destroy the White Worm.

Fabled Heirloom. The @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.HC3ZswckqlDOxMCV]{Eye of the White Worm}* can be claimed as a grotesque trophy from the withered corpse.

The Tall Man.name: 畸爪高影 (The Tall Man)
The Tall Man.text:
The Tall Man

Once a slender and agile archfey of the Greenwood who danced to the music of the forest, the Tall Man was twisted and rotted into an empty husk of his former self. Now, he silently lurks within the shadows between the trees. Emboldened by the Crooked Moon, he seeks to lure unsuspecting travelers to the woods so he may stalk his prey in a wicked game of cat and mouse. Once his prey is immobilized by terror, he uses his huge, gnarled fingers to snatch them up and dine on their flesh, made all the more delectable by their fear.

Terror Between the Trees

Wicked things lurk in the recovering woods of Hartsblight Forest. The shadows grow long as the moon draws nearer, and the people nearest to the forest’s edge are consumed by waking nightmares and entranced by dancing shadows that lure them into the thicket. Members of a small logging settlement seek out the characters and ask for help finding those who are missing.

Where Shadows Reign

With the destruction of Gorthos and the empowerment of the Crooked Moon, the Tall Man has made Hartsblight Forest his domain of terror, creating the ideal hunting grounds for the horrifying archfey and his corrupted court.

Fear of the Dark. For every hour of travel through Hartsblight Forest, each character must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 18]] saving throw or have disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls for 8 hours. A creature that can't be frightened succeeds automatically.

Trick of Shadows. Throughout Hartsblight Forest, shadowy silhouettes of the Tall Man linger between the trees. Characters who move within 10 feet of these silhouettes are attacked by four @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.OtCvUReRzsbKYFTf]{Lurkers in the Dark}*.

Easy Prey

When the characters arrive at the settlements near the forest’s edge, they are greeted by horrified shrieks and find the communities mostly empty. Those that remain are indifferent toward the characters and can't rip themselves from their waking nightmares. Any who suffer these nightmares wander into the woods and become lost.

Fear and Panic. Whenever the characters find a missing villager in the forest, the villager soon begins to scream in terror, drawing the attention of the Tall Man or his minions, unless the characters calm them with a successful group [[/check DEC DC 18]] or [[/check PER DC 18]] check.

Lost and Alone. Voices of the lost cry out to the characters, but the forest distorts their location. For every hour of travel through Hartsblight Forest, the characters must succeed on a group [[/check PRC DC 18]] or [[/check SUR DC 18]] check or spend the next 3 hours wandering through the woods, making no progress, and not finding the lost villager.

Court of Fear and Shadow

With newfound dominion over the forest, all of the dark wood serve the Tall Man, whether they be the denizens of the forest once blighted by Gorthos or the vicious members of his fey court.

Rotten Hearts. The denizens of Hartsblight Forest now dance with the Tall Man, including @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.PH78NBdvoaszAb61]{Death Dogs}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.VqpHUD4kyEsW9s2J]{Festerhulks}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.hQt3qIahnB1Odb40]{Giant Elks} (Undead), @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.vNrY5gd1iiqGtzbK]{Gloomwoods}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.zCFEcKc4a46mHGjB]{Hypnovulfen}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.iHBVa7sP0mTDvFtZ]{Keepers of the Blight}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.zY3W5MG7FjssENf6]{Owlbears}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.FdnMFAJJrBu42ctf]{Rotweavers}*, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.NB6wUgVqeOQtsQKu]{Treants}.

Bumps in the Night. The corrupted members of the fallen fey court serve their lord’s twisted appetites, taking the form of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.KOHVWl5RU9XBR8Jb]{Dryads}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.saq6WM959pKHuaqP]{Green Hags}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.FqcgFfeQkIDWCLak]{Heralds of Fools}* (Fey), @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.GQOjAbBUZg4KIHnf]{Ketgrinn}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.OtCvUReRzsbKYFTf]{Lurkers in the Dark}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rpVeW1GIxe9pyN64]{Revelers of Song}* (Fey), @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.lOBbUPgae5QLfYx1]{Revelers of Stories}* (Fey), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.MUpBNDoJEr09bLaO]{Sprites}.

Stalker in Darkness

The screeching villagers consumed by waking nightmares rave about the man between the trees, who dwells in his ruined palace of murk and misery. Rumors of the forgotten fey folk of the Greenwood are whispered by a few who know of the lithe dancing lord before he fell to rot. The characters must find his palace or lure him out to put an end to his reign of terror.

Fear in Folktales. The characters may seek out the folklore of these settlements, finding an old crone who knows of the Tall Man’s story and his palace if they succeed on a group [[/check ARC DC 18]] or [[/check PER DC 18]] check.

Hunting the Hunter. The characters can track and lure out the Tall Man with a successful group [[/check SUR DC 18]] check if they use fear to draw his attention.

The Slender One

Whether the characters discover the ruined palace or attempt to lure the withered archfey to them, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.IPd6YjfKVIKjyL9O]{The Tall Man}* knows of their coming and stalks them for hours before finally striking when the creeping dread is at its most intense.

Face Your Fears. When the Tall Man is slain, his body breaks and crumbles like dry bark, and the looming moon’s light pierces the canopy of the woodland once more as the terror lifts. Having been consumed by fear for so long, the denizens of the forest's edge can't find it in them to dread their coming deaths, and they go about their business as if nothing happened. The Crooked Moon turns to the Howlers, its light growing colder as it seeks its next champion.

Level Up. The characters reach 16th level, if they are still 15th level, when they destroy the Tall Man.

Fabled Heirloom. The @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.ek9SRS94Bd497y44]{Hook of the Tall Man}* can be claimed by removing a finger from the butchered archfey.

The Wild Titan.name: 蛮荒泰坦 (The Wild Titan)
The Wild Titan.text:
The Wild Titan

Created long ago by some unknown will for a purpose now lost to time, the Wild Titan is the wilderness made flesh. It once wandered the remote peaks of the Howlers, the mountain chain that makes up the western border of Wickermoor Hollow, following the rune stones of its creator after the creature lost all contact. As the centuries passed, its long, heavy strides became more of a struggle, and it grew weary from its aimlessness. And so, it slumbered until the Crooked Moon instilled the beast with primal fury, the very essence of its creation. Now, it seeks to bring the mountains down upon civilization and unleash the bestial savagery within all mortal beings.

Primal Rage

Savage howls and frigid wind echo through the mountains as colossal boulders crash upon the settlements below. A feral violence has erupted among the communities nestled in the foothills of the Howlers. Some have even lost their humanity as they transform into monsters. A miner from Dawn’s Gate who lost his family to these transformations pleads for the characters to bring an end to the wrath of the wilds.

The Rumbling

The looming, frigid mountain range of the Howlers is treacherous, but now it stands as a monument to unbound wilderness, as if the mountains themselves seek the destruction of civilized life.

Rocks Fall. Whether cast down by the Wild Titan or the mountains themselves, crashing stone tumbles from icy peaks. For every mile traveled within 1 mile of the Howlers, the characters must succeed on a [[/save DEX DC 18]] saving throw or take [[/damage 6d6 bludgeoning]]{21 (6d6)} bludgeoning damage and [[/damage 4d6 cold]]{14 (4d6)} cold damage.

Make No Fire. The harsh elements make it impossible for travelers to benefit from the warmth of fire. Within 5 miles of the Howlers, open flames, including torches and bonfires, are snuffed out instantly, and all fire damage is halved.

The Beasts Within

When the characters arrive at Dawn’s Gate or any of the mining settlements at the base of the Howlers, they find rampant destruction and few buildings standing. Grunting townsfolk incapable of speech attack on sight and try to devour flesh. Even more dreadful are the hairy monsters that still linger on the fringes of the communities and drag screaming victims into the wilderness.

Going Berserk. Whenever a character comes within 10 feet of a villager afflicted with primal wrath or starts a turn there, they must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 18]] saving throw or go berserk until the start of their next turn, perceiving all creatures as enemies. While berserk, on each of their turns, a character must move to the nearest creature and take the Attack action against it. Characters who succeed on the saving throw are immune to this effect for 24 hours.

Titan’s Roar. Strange roars bellow from the mountains. Every hour while within 1 mile of a settlement, each character must succeed on a [[/save CHA DC 18]] saving throw or gain one Mark of the Wild Titan. When a character reaches three of these marks, they instantly transform into an @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.cqngSsseMctLr7Y6]{Alpengrendel}*. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl]{Remove Curse} spell removes one or two accumulated marks.

Where the Wild Things Are

The untamed wilderness where the Wild Titan roams is filled with ferocious predators incensed by the howling of the hairy colossus. These include ravenous beasts and primeval entities drawn by the runestones that dot the peaks.

Menacing Menagerie. The creatures of the Howlers have gone berserk with the urge to destroy anything civilized, including @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.cqngSsseMctLr7Y6]{Alpengrendel}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.x47ZnpHfYl0ptDM9]{Behir}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.WNNEFUmuHFevNfqx]{Boneflayers}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.EYiQZ3rFL25fEJY5]{Dire Wolves}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.8MuL8xisavJW9bnw]{Giant Apes}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.MiYRAIHwm9It1in8]{Mammoths}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.hb6pjvdCNYmLLp8V]{Polar Bears}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.eIGowKTkEBC9gUzx]{Ogres}, Remorhazes, Rocs, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.ZHAFrnCwCz17dmLc]{Trolls4}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.yGTh874etxUckmAf]{Winter Wolves}.

Spirits of the Wild. The ancient runestones of the Howlers call forth beings of the wild. These take the form of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.sApYLZj9PTZ40wJr]{Earth Elementals}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.Buxe6dDK5Mw7kxe6]{Frost Giants} (Elemental), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.0m8QyDN52qw9zzOM]{Gargoyles}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.ESEm3fGUfSKjzVUc]{Ice Mephits}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SOin81NWijHRvXFK]{Stone Giants} (Elemental), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.z3gSIXHHWYaHjfBT]{Stone Golems}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.wPch5z2x4VlD7Kd5]{Wildpyres}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.sT0JVpd1TGEWv540]{Woodwarped}*, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.2MZNHeOZweXAYbv1]{Xorn}.

Attack on the Titan

The constant rumbling of the mountain crashing into the valley below and the howling of savage monsters cause the survivors and the villagers who remain to believe that the spirit of the mountain itself wishes to destroy them before the Crooked Moon does. Some, however, remember the tales of the titan that walks the peaks and the stones it uses as a guide, and the most cunning or desperate trackers are willing to sacrifice everything to bring an end to the titan’s assault.

In the Runes. The characters can follow the clues left in the runestones along the mountainside. A successful group [[/check HIS DC 18]] or [[/check NAT DC 18]] check allows the characters to discover the Wild Titan’s story and the path that it treads through the Howlers.

Dangerous Game. The characters encounter a grizzled hunter with a relentless dedication to kill the Wild Titan as a final triumph. A successful group [[/check SUR DC 18]] check aids him in finding his quarry through wilderness tracking.

The Abominable Wildman

When the characters make the ascent to the peaks of the Howlers and find the path of the wandering giant, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.9v5OzJNAF4k0phid]{The Wild Titan}* makes the approach deadly with an onslaught of rockslides and avalanches. It is prepared for a brutal battle for survival, issuing a bellowing challenge and seeking to crush all civilized beings beneath its enormous feet.

Harder the Fall. When the Wild Titan is slain, it lets out a mournful roar, having never discovered its purpose or the reason for its creation, before tumbling down the mountain like a boulder. The settlements among the foothills, especially Dawn’s Gate, regain their senses. Despite the looming apocalypse, they immediately start rebuilding their crumbled communities. The Crooked Moon shifts once again, its baleful stare focusing now on Maidenmist Cemetery.

Level Up. The characters reach 17th level, if they are still 16th level, when they destroy the Wild Titan.

Fabled Heirloom. The @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.pKAMlxe2mbMClXw5]{Runestone of the Wild Titan}* can be found near the site of the battle once the beast has been cast off the mountain.

The Barrow King.name: 荒冢之王 (The Barrow King)
The Barrow King.text:
The Barrow King

None living know the origin of the long-dead monarch entombed in the grand barrow of Maidenmist Cemetery (see chapter 19), but legends of his undying army of wights, immense necromantic might, and unmatched combat prowess are told in hushed tones around campfires or the corners of taverns. Even the unrelenting primordial element of death condensed in the Shroud seeks to corrupt this ruler, but his tomb proved too impenetrable. Now, with the Crooked Moon casting its sight upon the endless graves, the one known as the Barrow King has risen to conquer a new kingdom of the dead.

Death Reigns Here

The graves of Maidenmist Cemetery burst open, and the shambling dead rise to join the undying legions of the Barrow King as he prepares for a bloody conquest of the living, many of whom submit to the awesome necromantic power. Every night, the army of death grows and pledges sword, bow, and axe to their monarch. An inhabitant of Wickermoor Village rushes to the characters, claiming they are the last line of defense against the march of death.

All the World’s a Grave

The land itself floods with necromantic power as the graveyard of Maidenmist spreads beyond its cold iron fence. The earth churns, graves open up, decay of living matter quickens, and a dense, shroud-infused fog rolls across the valley.

Death and Decay. Any healing within 10 miles of Maidenmist Cemetery is halved.

Draining Shroud. The dense fog saps the lifeforce from the living. For every hour spent within 10 miles of Maidenmist Cemetery, the characters must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level of exhaustion. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.VtCXMdyM6mAdIJZb]{Death Ward}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SLxA9QhrggTz0taU]{Hallow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.y8A4HfTwd93ypdEz]{Magic Circle}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.xmDBqZhRVrtLP8h2]{Protection from Evil and Good} spell prevents this exhaustion.

The Scourge of the Damned

The Barrow King’s influence spreads across the land, converting enthralled townsfolk into loyal cultists that advance his aims, Further, a plague rips through settlements that leaves its victims as mindless walking corpses.

Death Cults. Any villager encountered by the characters after the Barrow King rises has a 50 percent chance of being a member of a necrotic cult, which can be deduced with a successful [[/check INS DC 19]] check. These cultists attempt to guide the characters to their death or infect them with necrotic plague.

Necrotic Pestilence. A magical contagion spreads through the population of Wickermoor Hollow. Whenever a character ends their turn within 5 feet of an infected creature, they must succeed on a [[/save CON DC 19]] saving throw or be &reference[poisoned apply=false]. While poisoned in this way, the character takes [[/damage 2d12 necrotic]]{13 (2d12)} necrotic damage at the end of every hour, which decreases their hit point maximum by the same amount. If a character is killed by the plague, their corpse rises as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.rbyp54px2D0ql4QK]{Wight} 8 hours later.

Call the Banners

The Barrow King commands endless legions of Undead that gather in masses of corpse and spirit, preparing for their inevitable march upon the land. They are joined by twisted monsters bound to the monarch’s will.

Army of the Dead. The living dead form most of the Barrow King’s forces, including @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.IyIybE5t2adMEVUM]{Ghasts}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.dIyqjDIqRxD56Njq]{Kackles}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.t8WYD7ak07X7xpx8]{Mummies}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.gIM2KVjsPra8DzZd]{Night Creatures}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.n6v8HLbHbKBRjVAH]{Phantom Hearses}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.S5NNrWLkqfQKTs1h]{Shrouded}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.PuPo4H4Dcxigf0fY]{Specters}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.zpaZb7I8alY32vWV]{Vampire Spawn}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.rbyp54px2D0ql4QK]{Wights}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.ET4PEVEiNJLU4f7c]{Wraiths}.

Horde of Domination. Monstrous creatures of the night also serve the Barrow King, taking the form of @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.D0fw0qKqrqj5078T]{Bat Hounds}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.WNNEFUmuHFevNfqx]{Boneflayers}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.PH78NBdvoaszAb61]{Death Dogs}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.80MeeiJWRBHrLuCR]{Fleshdobbins}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.iSCL4Q82ivnYelzc]{Hell Hounds}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.qU6bq3aePq1uwl9T]{Necrolisks}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.xvh2UOKv1bh03Gih]{Night Hags}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.llSG0Hi4eGlRlQ4o]{Phase Spiders}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.FdnMFAJJrBu42ctf]{Rotweavers}* (Monstrosity), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.6oc29m5uzzzb0pk3]{Vrocks}.

Wrath of the Barrow King

As a plague tears through the valley and the sinister cult grows more influential, the people begin to resign themselves to a fate of undeath. The only way to destroy the monarch is by infiltrating his tomb, and knowledge of such a thing is nearly lost to Druskenvald. Only the dead hold such secrets.

Grim History. By exhuming graves and tombs throughout Maidenmist Cemetery, characters can discover how to breach the royal barrow with a successful group [[/check ARC DC 19]]. or [[/check HIS DC 19]] check.

Ghostly Communion. Spirits of the tortured dead still linger, some not entirely under the dominion of the Barrow King. A successful group [[/check PER DC 19]] check when communing with such a spirit convinces a long-dead ghost to reveal their secrets.

Kill the King

Entering the royal tomb, the characters find that the stone has given way, and a network of catacombs and crypts winds deep into the earth, surging with the living dead. In the bowels of this subterranean fortress, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.6bKvmUDO3OwfCtDN]{The Barrow King}* awaits the interlopers on a grand throne of skulls. He rises to meet the battle head-on, fighting with overwhelming necromantic power and grave honor.

End of an Empire. When the Barrow King is defeated, his army of the dead collapses into piles of desiccated flesh and bone. The royal barrow and the catacombs beneath it collapse, and the spread of death comes to an end. The people of Wickermoor Village recover from the plague and turn to the Old Ways, performing numerous strange rituals to prevent the coming doom. The Crooked Moon looks northward to the Drowned Crossroads.

Level Up. The characters reach 18th level, if they are still 17th level, when they destroy the Barrow King.

Fabled Heirloom. The crumbled remains of the monarch wear the @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.aTzIjmCcU3rpYjUf]{Crown of the Barrow King}*.

The Jinxed Leviathan.name: 厄难巨鳄 (The Jinxed Leviathan)
The Jinxed Leviathan.text:
The Jinxed Leviathan

Long ago, a simple alligator was captured by a cabal of jinxcraft-practicing magicians that poured hexes into it, creating an enormous swamp beast fused with bad luck itself, all in hopes of defeating the powerful death spirit known as Snake Eye Jack (see chapter 15). However, this misfortune fell upon the Jinxed Leviathan’s captors when it broke free from their spell and devoured every last one of them, disappearing into the darkest tangled reaches of the Drowned Crossroads. Now, with the gaze of the Crooked Moon upon it, this reptilian colossus has risen to the surface once more, bringing misfortune and death to all those in its path.

Get Jinxed

A terrible hex afflicts the Drowned Crossroads, bringing nothing but misfortune to its people. Horrible accidents, sudden sicknesses, and shocking disappearances occur by the hour, and even the simplest tasks can bring about a gruesome death. A resident of Murkwater Bend approaches the party, claiming that things are far worse than the jinxcraft of Mister Crossroads and begging for salvation before the swamp community’s luck runs out.

Mire of Mishaps

With the terrible jinx upon the Drowned Crossroads, every inch of the swamp is treacherous, with the bayou itself animated and twisted into a strange, glowing mockery of what it once was.

The Worst Luck. A jinx afflicts the swamp. When a character makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, it must subtract [[/r 1d4]] from the total.

Swamplights. Eerie, jinxed hues radiate from patches of water, plants, and mud throughout the swamp. For every hour spent in the bayou, the characters must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 19]] saving throw or be affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.9hQXdMSmerkTsHDe]{Confusion} spell for 10 minutes. If one or more characters fail the save, a @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.39jY1cMlEslsjtuW]{Bayou Beast}* rises from the swamp and attacks.

Poor Unfortunate Souls

The people of the Drowned Crossroads react to their turmoil with two different extremes: some party and live life to the fullest because they know their luck will soon run out, while others desperately try to appease the beast by any means necessary.

Last Dance. Many of the locals of the Drowned Crossroads are celebrating the last party before the apocalypse. They will use jinxcraft to convince others to party with them. Any character who starts their turn within 15 feet of one of these locals must succeed on a [[/save CHA DC 19]] saving throw or be &reference[charmed apply=false] for 24 hours. While charmed in this way, the character parties without rest and gains 1 level of exhaustion at the end of that time. Characters who fail can repeat this saving throw every hour, and characters who succeed are immune for 24 hours.

Appeasing Meal. Many panicked swampfolk wish to calm the leviathan with sacrificial meals. Groups wander the swamps looking for victims. Every 8 hours spent in the Drowned Crossroads, the characters must succeed on a group [[/check STE DC 19]] check or be found and attacked by 20 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.rb7OJt822wIO52qY]{Bandit Captains} seeking a new offering.

Swamp Things

The bayou has come to life with malevolent monsters that search for new meals for the Jinxed Leviathan, from hexed flora and fauna to the living dead and thralls risen from the unstable jinxcraft.

Bog Beasts. The swamp itself rises up at the command of the Jinxed Leviathan, including @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.39jY1cMlEslsjtuW]{Bayou Beasts}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.nZMEV4jjo1MaG1xI]{Dream Eaters}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.NpvwE1feOHyEqAbP]{Giant Constrictor Snakes}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.3YwmvDupMwycWNCO]{Giant Crocodiles}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.Ixo5shumxy4I9qyD]{Giant Toads}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.vNrY5gd1iiqGtzbK]{Gloomwoods}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.dYtBDxMs6HfcJO8E]{Gobblegeists}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.gGeLeV411iQ5Yijs]{Shambling Mounds}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.BAT6ld8qJZetpycL]{Spirit Nagas}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.namJz755U1EhvEJa]{Water Elementals}, and whippoorwill flocks (use @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.1zXL5U1wR5aMwloG]{Crowstorm}* stat block).

Jinxed Servants. Risen dead and bewitched thralls serve the beast, taking the form of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.sLdpiuaZF8lujJQy]{Barbed Devils}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.1oxbV4k12bkv65DC]{Deepdrecks}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Wou9MoWctZhNBzi0]{Ferrymen}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.VqpHUD4kyEsW9s2J]{Festerhulks}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.MADGs8pWMVyyFOf1]{Horned Devils}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.dIyqjDIqRxD56Njq]{Kackles}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.vZTvzdrNT55h7MSl]{Lake Dredgers}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.ZHAFrnCwCz17dmLc]{Trolls}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.RenLfmDT2XlbCF4x]{Ogre Zombies}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rFMEL5osbYoxsJEZ]{Wayward Haints}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.wPch5z2x4VlD7Kd5]{Wildpyres}*, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.8KSVpQZyzius93ko]{Will-o’-Wisps}.

The Leviathan Smiles

Every night that goes by sees more folk succumb to the worsening misfortune, and the survivors increasingly resign themselves to hedonism as the raging revelry reaches a fever pitch. Only by baiting the swamp beast or finding its cursed bayou can the characters slay it and finally end the madness.

Bait the Beast. Although the Jinxed Leviathan will eat most living things, its favorite meal is a giant serpent sacred to the followers of Snake Eye Jack. One of these creatures can be found and used to bait the giant swamp monster into a trap with a successful group [[/check ANI DC 19]] or [[/check SUR DC 19]] check.

Accursed Murk. Although the story has been lost for generations, some survivors familiar with the folklore of the swamp tell the story of the cabal that sought to depose Snake Eye Jack. The location where the Jinxed Leviathan was first transformed can be learned with a successful group [[/check ITM DC 19]] or [[/check PER DC 19]] check.

The Monster of Misfortune

No matter how the characters approach the behemoth, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.31QEGa6vRpH7cm8l]{The Jinxed Leviathan}* erupts from the depths of the swamp, turning the black water of the bayou into raging waves. Glowing jinxcraft glyphs appear on every surface around it as its eternal hex spreads far and wide. Its jaws gnash and its tail thrashes in an effort to turn the characters into its finest meal yet.

Turn of Luck. When the Jinxed Leviathan is slain, it lets out a bellow and collapses into the murk. Immediately, the swamp grows dark and quiet as the powerful jinx that has cursed the Drowned Crossroads is broken and lifted. With the misfortune finally banished from the bayou, the people of Murkwater Bend and other settlements celebrate even more wildly than before, hoping to go out with a bang. The Crooked Moon turns its gaze southward to the Webwoods.

Level Up. The characters reach 19th level, if they are still 18th level, when they destroy the Jinxed Leviathan.

Fabled Heirloom. The @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-treasury.Item.Xeet8gmdbdgu6RRP]{Tooth of the Jinxed Leviathan}* can be pulled from the maw of the slain beast.

The Dusk Mother.name: 黄昏之母 (The Dusk Mother)
The Dusk Mother.text:
The Dusk Mother

Once a human seamstress who practiced witchcraft, the mournful shade known only as the Dusk Mother was driven to inconsolable sorrow after she slew her children in a feverish ritual while possessed by a demonic entity she let into her home. In death, she has lingered in Wickermoor Hollow as a spirit clad in white, filled with immeasurable grief and hate. With the gaze of the Crooked Moon upon the Webwoods, a remote forest south of Wickermoor Village, her tether to the world of the living is at its strongest, and she seeks to ensure that all the valley shares in her misery.

The Threads that Bind

There is a ghostly witch in the Webwoods, and the humble farming communities near the forest’s edge are under her spell. The crops wither and die, the livestock turn up mutilated, the children disappear, and adults awaken with their eyes and mouths sewn shut—catatonic husks robbed of their souls. A teenage girl from a homestead, barely escaping the wrath of her parents after her siblings went missing, finds the characters and begs them to bring salvation to the forest’s edge.

The Webs They Weave

The Dusk Mother’s hut lies in the Webwoods, a forest normally overrun with enormous spiders but is now a network of webbing filled with haunted, spectral energies and agonized crying.

Tangled Webs. The Webwoods are choked with webs that seem to have a mind of their own. For every mile traveled through the wood, the characters must succeed on a [[/save DEX DC 20]] saving throw or be &reference[restrained apply=false] (escape DC 18) and &reference[poisoned apply=false] for 8 hours. Additionally, each character who fails is immediately attacked by eight @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.aKt7vFAS1J0x3FQm]{Ettercaps}.

Ghostly Wails. Mournful wails of the Dusk Mother can be heard all around. For every hour spent within 5 miles of the tree line of the Webwoods, the characters must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 20]] saving throw or be &reference[incapacitated apply=false] for 10 minutes as they break down into tears.

Come Little Children

The communities and homesteads near the Webwoods are nearly abandoned. The children have disappeared into the woods, and the adults that remain are bewitched and succumb to fits of convulsion and catatonic spells, barely responding to external stimuli.

Severed Soul. The eyes and mouths of the adults who remain are sewn shut. They have no souls, and their bodies seek new ones to inhabit them. Any character who cuts the threads and opens someone’s eyes and mouth must succeed on a [[/save CHA DC 20]] saving throw or have their soul trapped within the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{Commoner's} body as if by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ej6wyY4G1gOcb1U6]{Magic Jar} spell for 8 hours.

Babes in the Wood. Numerous children have been bewitched and lured into the woods by the Dusk Mother, crying and whimpering for their parents or siblings. When a character moves within 5 feet of a child, the child’s face turns wicked and they scream. Any character within 15 feet of the screaming child must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 20]] saving throw or be &reference[charmed apply=false] by the Dusk Mother as if by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.eEpy1ONlXumKS1mp]{Dominate Monster} spell for 1 hour.

Puppets on Strings

The occult magic of the Dusk Mother is immensely powerful, utilizing ancient witchcraft to master soul weaving. This has allowed her to bind spirits and other monsters of the valley to her mournful and malicious will.

Here Be Haunts. Otherworldly entities conjured and dominated by the Dusk Mother take the form of @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.IY9xoFINnJsrOXll]{Corvodaemons}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.mWbrPhcKOz6oLXMV]{Doppelgangers}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.3o2rQBqpzjIHmrBW]{Erinyes}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.qoFEjfrANBdrCP6m]{Ghosts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.saq6WM959pKHuaqP]{Green Hags}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.VmdyZDjqAc8vdncY]{Incubi}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.oDspGxRQFBhE74L2]{Invisible Stalkers}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.GQOjAbBUZg4KIHnf]{Ketgrinn}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.egsSDYbqoLCelb0J]{Mariliths}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.xvh2UOKv1bh03Gih]{Night Hags}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.L1w8yBkInMscfJ3F]{Oni}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.n6v8HLbHbKBRjVAH]{Phantom Hearses}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.Jj23zmBla6ZrN6po]{Pumpkin Heads}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.rpVeW1GIxe9pyN64]{Revelers of Song}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.lOBbUPgae5QLfYx1]{Revelers of Stories}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.S5NNrWLkqfQKTs1h]{Shrouded}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.VmdyZDjqAc8vdncY]{Succubi}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.ET4PEVEiNJLU4f7c]{Wraiths}.

Dolled Up. Puppeted monsters and strange dolls crafted by the Dusk Mother and given life stalk the woods, taking the form of @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.cqngSsseMctLr7Y6]{Alpengrendel}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.YOqhbf8WsX0jH9Fu]{Clay Golems}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.DmufsvYsb3sUkAp9]{Drakkenhobs}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.1OQbxoZI5BtlB2ME]{Driders}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.aKt7vFAS1J0x3FQm]{Ettercaps}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.80MeeiJWRBHrLuCR]{Fleshdobbins}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.Hm4o2FgPZsdbXjLq]{Flesh Golems}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.dYtBDxMs6HfcJO8E]{Gobblegeists}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.CqQ6pXQA5WXZNOm3]{Harpies}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.gZG3Lxd820zA03iF]{Houses of Horror}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.zCFEcKc4a46mHGjB]{Hypnovulfen}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.OtCvUReRzsbKYFTf]{Lurkers in the Dark}*, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-bestiary.Actor.gd4HzvJIzwSfMtyz]{Maidenwoods}*, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.zY3W5MG7FjssENf6]{Owlbears}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.llSG0Hi4eGlRlQ4o]{Phase Spiders}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.7tRhrxuknTpHpYcA]{Werewolves}.

Wicked Woman of the Woods

The people near the Webwoods have nearly been wiped out, and the children become more lost in the woods with every night that passes. The increasing quiet is more unsettling than the sniffling cries. Only by finding the Dusk Mother’s hut, to which her spirit is bound, can the characters purge her spirit and cleanse the land of her sorrow and hate.

Nursery Rhymes. Although the missing children are bewitched by the Dusk Mother, they have seen her hut. When the characters encounter a child who sings haunting rhymes about the shade in white, they can piece together the location of the hut with a successful group [[/check ARC DC 20]] or [[/check HIS DC 20]] check.

Queen of Webs. The arachnids of the Webwoods serve the Dusk Mother and view her as their spider queen. Characters who observe the skittering patterns of these local beasts and succeed on a group [[/check ANI DC 20]] or [[/check SUR DC 20]] check can follow them to the spirit’s haunted hut.

The Woman in White
